analyzed: ma h'a ra su tri ta su tro sha su su kho badzra sa tva aa dya siddha mam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Mahā-rasu-tri-su-troṣa-su-sukha-vajra-satva-adyā-siddha-mam.

original: de nas rdo rje gar las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag rgya chen po bcings la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje gar las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag rgya chen po bcings la /
translated: Then, having formed the great seal of the Blessed One arisen from the vajra dance,

original: g-yon pa'i rdo rje mig gis ni //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i rdo rje mig gis ni //
translated: with the vajra eye of the left,

original: de yi mgon po la phyag bya //
analyzed: de yi mgon po la phyag bya //
translated: one should pay homage to his lord.

original: g-yon bsnyems bzhin pas bstod pa yis ;
analyzed: g-yon bsnyems bzhin pas bstod pa yis ;
translated: With the left one should praise with a haughty manner,

original: / sgeg ma'i mig ni btsums pa'o //
analyzed: / sgeg ma'i mig ni btsums pa'o //
translated: and with the charming eye one should close them.

original: aom mchog tu bde ba'i sems ni rol bar ldan //
analyzed: aom mchog tu bde ba'i sems ni rol bar ldan //
translated: Om, with a mind of supreme bliss, one should enjoy,

original: sgeg pa'i phyag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'dud //
analyzed: sgeg pa'i phyag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'dud //
translated: and with charming hands one should bow to the Blessed One.

original: dza: h'um bam ho: hi hi hi hi he //
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: hi hi hi hi he //
translated: Jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, hi hi hi hi he,

original: mgon po snyim pa'i me tog bzhes su gsol //
analyzed: mgon po snyim pa'i me tog bzhes su gsol //
translated: lord, please accept the flowers of the palms.

original: slar yang 'jug pa'i phyag rgya bcings la dkyil 'khor la lan gsum bskor ba byas te /
analyzed: slar yang 'jug pa'i phyag rgya bcings la dkyil 'khor la lan gsum bskor ba byas te /
translated: Again, having formed the entrance seal, one should circumambulate the maṇḍala three times,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du 'dug la de kho na nyid 'di lan cig brjod par bya ste /🔽'dod chags chen po bde ba che //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi mdun du 'dug la de kho na nyid 'di lan cig brjod par bya ste / 'dod chags chen po bde ba che //
translated: and sit in front of the Blessed One and recite this reality once:🔽Great passion, great bliss,

original: rdo rje chen po nor che ba //
analyzed: rdo rje chen po nor che ba //
translated: great vajra, great wealth,

original: ye shes chen po las chen po //
analyzed: ye shes chen po las chen po //
translated: The great one from the great intuition,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' deng bdag grub //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' deng bdag grub //
translated: Vajrasattva is accomplished today in me.

original: ces bya'o // 'di yang brjod par bya ste /🔽dza: h'um @59a * //
analyzed: ces bya'o // 'di yang brjod par bya ste / dza: h'um @59a * //
translated: This also should be uttered:

original: bam ho:/ pra ti siddhi mam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bam ho:/ pra ti siddhi mam zhes bya'o //
translated: Jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, pratisthāmaṇi.

original: de nas rdo rje'i chu 'thungs la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje'i chu 'thungs la /
translated: Then, having drunk the vajra water,

original: g-yon pa'i khro bo'i khu tshur gyis sems dpa' rdo rje ma'i phyag rgya dral zhing h'um aa zhes bya bas lan brgya brjod cing bdag nyid la dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i khro bo'i khu tshur gyis sems dpa' rdo rje ma'i phyag rgya dral zhing h'um aa zhes bya bas lan brgya brjod cing bdag nyid la dbab par bya'o //
translated: with the angry fist of the left, one should tear open the seal of the sattva-vajra gesture, and with the utterance of hūṃ a one hundred times, one should cause it to descend into oneself.

original: de nas me tog sil ma gtor bar bya ste //
analyzed: de nas me tog sil ma gtor bar bya ste //
translated: Then one should scatter loose flowers,

original: ka pu ta yi thal mo ni ;
analyzed: ka pu ta yi thal mo ni ;
translated: with the añjali gesture of the kapāla,

original: / spyi bor bzhag ste phab nas kyang //
analyzed: / spyi bor bzhag ste phab nas kyang //
translated: placing it on the head and letting it fall,

original: sgeg bcas mthe bong mthe chung bar //
analyzed: sgeg bcas mthe bong mthe chung bar //
translated: with grace, the thumb and little finger

original: bkrol nas rdo rje 'dzin la dbul //
analyzed: bkrol nas rdo rje 'dzin la dbul //
translated: should be released and offered to the vajra-holder.

original: de nas phyag 'tshal ba'i sngags brjod cing bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag 'tshal ba'i sngags brjod cing bya'o //
translated: Then, one should do the homage, uttering the mantra.

original: de nas phreng ba de sngags 'dis rang gi spyi bor bcing bar bya ste //
analyzed: de nas phreng ba de sngags 'dis rang gi spyi bor bcing bar bya ste //
translated: Then, one should bind that garland to one's head with this mantra:

original: 'dod pa kun gyi dbang phyug nyid //
analyzed: 'dod pa kun gyi dbang phyug nyid //
translated: The lord of all desires,

original: sems can kun la bde stsol ba //
analyzed: sems can kun la bde stsol ba //
translated: Granting happiness to all sentient beings,

original: thams cad grub phyir rdor 'dzin gyi //
analyzed: thams cad grub phyir rdor 'dzin gyi //
translated: for the sake of the accomplishment of all,

original: de ring khyed la dbang bskur mdzad //
analyzed: de ring khyed la dbang bskur mdzad //
translated: today you will be empowered by Vajradhara.

original: aom ma h'a su kha badzra sa tva stvam aa bhi shinytsa su ra ta stvam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: aom ma h'a su kha badzra sa tva stvam aa bhi shinytsa su ra ta stvam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Om, great bliss, be firm, O Vajrasattva, I consecrate you, you are consecrated, you are firm.

original: de nas badzra tsa kshu sa ma ya sarbam su ra ta stvam zhes bya ba 'dis gdong g-yogs dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas badzra tsa kshu sa ma ya sarbam su ra ta stvam zhes bya ba 'dis gdong g-yogs dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: Then, with Vajra Eye, Samaya, all are consecrated, you are firm, he should remove the blindfold.

original: de nas yi ge h'um las mig gnyis su rdo rje rnam par bsams la he badzra p'a shya zhes brjod cing /
analyzed: de nas yi ge h'um las mig gnyis su rdo rje rnam par bsams la he badzra p'a shya zhes brjod cing /
translated: Then, from the syllable hum, he should imagine two vajras in his two eyes, and saying, “Hevajra, behold!”

original: rdo rje lcags kyu ma nas brtsams te dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi dkyil 'khor la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu ma nas brtsams te dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi dkyil 'khor la blta bar bya'o //
translated: he should behold the mandala, beginning with Vajra Hook and ending with glorious Vajrasattva.

original: de nas tishtha badzra zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi snying gar 'jug pa'i phyag rgya bcings te dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas tishtha badzra zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi snying gar 'jug pa'i phyag rgya bcings te dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: Then, with “Stand, vajra,” and so on, he should form the gesture of summoning to his heart and release it.

original: rdo rje thal mo bskor bshis par brjod pa sbyin pa'i tshul gyis snying ga'i phyogs su bzung zhing mtshan brgya rtsas bcom ldan 'das la bstod de /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo bskor bshis par brjod pa sbyin pa'i tshul gyis snying ga'i phyogs su bzung zhing mtshan brgya rtsas bcom ldan 'das la bstod de /
translated: One should hold the vajra palms together at the heart area, and praise the Bhagavat with the one hundred names, as if giving a gift.

original: 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhi dang glu dang gar gyi mchod pas yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa gsang ba'i mchod pa bzhi dang glu dang gar gyi mchod pas yang dag par mchod la /
translated: One should make perfect offerings with the four secret offerings of Rāgavajra and so on, and with the offerings of song and dance.

original: rang gi bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: One should bless oneself as Vajrasattva.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis rang gi lus la gnas ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par bkod nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyis rang gi lus la gnas ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par bkod nas /
translated: One should arrange all the deities of the mandala in one’s body, in their respective places, with one’s pledge seals.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad legs so'i sbyor bas de bzhin du lus kun la yang dag par bcug la bzhag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad legs so'i sbyor bas de bzhin du lus kun la yang dag par bcug la bzhag ste /
translated: One should cause all the tathāgatas to enter and rest in one’s body with the yoga of “excellent.”

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi nang du shar gyi sgor mngon par phyogs par sna tshogs padma bris te /
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi nang du shar gyi sgor mngon par phyogs par sna tshogs padma bris te /
translated: One should draw a variegated lotus inside the outer maṇḍala, facing the eastern door.

original: de'i steng du dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen pos nye bar 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: de'i steng du dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgya chen pos nye bar 'dug pa'am /
translated: On top of that, he should sit down with the great seal of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: yang na dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor du sna tshogs padma bris @59b pa'i ras ris kyis bkab pa'i seng ge'i gdan la 'dug ste /
analyzed: yang na dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor du sna tshogs padma bris @59b pa'i ras ris kyis bkab pa'i seng ge'i gdan la 'dug ste /
translated: Or else, he should sit on a lion seat covered by a cloth on which a variegated lotus is drawn in the mandala for conferring initiation.

original: mchod yon phul la sngon du 'gro ba'i mchod pa lngas bdag nyid yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: mchod yon phul la sngon du 'gro ba'i mchod pa lngas bdag nyid yang dag par mchod la /
translated: Having offered water for the feet, he should make offerings to himself with the five offerings.

original: rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa las rdo rje khu tshur gyis chu blangs te dbang bskur bar bya zhing /
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa las rdo rje khu tshur gyis chu blangs te dbang bskur bar bya zhing /
translated: He should confer initiation with the water from the victorious vase, having taken it up with the vajra fist.

original: chu de btung bar yang bya'o //
analyzed: chu de btung bar yang bya'o //
translated: He should also drink that water.

original: de yang aom badzra aa bhi shi nytsa h'um zhes bya ba brjod cing //
analyzed: de yang aom badzra aa bhi shi nytsa h'um zhes bya ba brjod cing //
translated: He should also say this, “Oṃ, Vajra bestow initiation, hūṃ.”

original: 'di ni khyod kyi dmyal pa'i chu //
analyzed: 'di ni khyod kyi dmyal pa'i chu //
translated: “This is your hell water.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mna' bsgag pa'i snying po yang brjod cing bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mna' bsgag pa'i snying po yang brjod cing bya'o //
translated: ” He should also say this essence of the oath.

original: de nas gos dang rgyan rnams kyis bdag nyid brgyan la /
analyzed: de nas gos dang rgyan rnams kyis bdag nyid brgyan la /
translated: Then, he should adorn himself with the garments and ornaments.

original: sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan gyi phyag rgya'i dbang bskur ba dang / phyi'i yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i cod pan dang dar dpyangs kyis dbang bskur ba blangs nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga'i cod pan gyi phyag rgya'i dbang bskur ba dang / phyi'i yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i cod pan dang dar dpyangs kyis dbang bskur ba blangs nas /
translated: Having received the empowerment of the seal of the diadem of the five buddhas and the external empowerment of the diadem of the five tathāgatas and the streamers,

original: rdo rje dang bdag po dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba dang / dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs kyang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dang bdag po dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba dang / dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs kyang gzung bar bya'o //
translated: one should also take up the vajra, the master, the name empowerment, and the spiritual powers and the vajra observances.

original: de nas phyi'i me tog la sogs pas bdag nyid yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: de nas phyi'i me tog la sogs pas bdag nyid yang dag par mchod la /
translated: Then, with external flowers, etc., one should make offerings to oneself.

original: 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'i mchod pa bcu gnyis kyis yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'i mchod pa bcu gnyis kyis yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings with the twelve offerings of the seals of Rāgavajrā, etc.

original: de nas de kho na nyid chos dang dam tshig rnams blangs la dril bu dkrol zhing dam tshig gsum gyi glu'i mchod pa bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nas de kho na nyid chos dang dam tshig rnams blangs la dril bu dkrol zhing dam tshig gsum gyi glu'i mchod pa bya ba yin no //
translated: Then, having taken up the realities, the Dharmas, and the pledges, one should make the offering of the song of the three pledges, ringing the bell.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas nas snying po dang phyag rgya bzhi'i ye shes bcom ldan 'das las blangs la tshigs su bcad pa lngas rjes su gnang ba dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / lung bstan pa blangs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag byas nas snying po dang phyag rgya bzhi'i ye shes bcom ldan 'das las blangs la tshigs su bcad pa lngas rjes su gnang ba dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / lung bstan pa blangs te /
translated: Then, having made obeisance to the Bhagavat, one should take the knowledge of the essence and the four seals from the Bhagavat, and take the permission, the encouragement, and the prediction with the five verses.

original: slar yang bdag byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa dang / ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i bzlas pa byas te 'byung bar bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang bdag byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa dang / ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i bzlas pa byas te 'byung bar bya'o //
translated: Then, again, one should perform the self-consecration, etc., and the repetition as desired, and one should emerge.

original: slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi las kyi cho ga yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o /
translated: This concludes the master’s ritual actions.

original: // / de nas slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga bya ste /
translated: Then one should perform the ritual for inducting the disciples, and so on.

original: rdo rje mchod yon bskor zhing gnas //🔽snying gar bzhag ste gdong bskyod pa'i //
analyzed: rdo rje mchod yon bskor zhing gnas // snying gar bzhag ste gdong bskyod pa'i //
translated: Circumambulate the vajra-drinking water and remain.🔽Place it at the heart and shake the face.

original: spyi bos yang dag phyag byas nas //
analyzed: spyi bos yang dag phyag byas nas //
translated: Having bowed with the head,

original: dngos grub thams cad rab grub pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad rab grub pa'o //
translated: all powers are well accomplished.

original: bde ba chen po chags pa che//
analyzed: bde ba chen po chags pa che//
translated: Great passion is great bliss.

original: 'gro kun la yang 'grub 'gyur zhes //
analyzed: 'gro kun la yang 'grub 'gyur zhes //
translated: It is accomplished for all beings.

original: lan gsum bskor ba byas nas ni //
analyzed: lan gsum bskor ba byas nas ni //
translated: Having circumambulated three times,

original: bstod de dkyil 'khor du gzhug bya //
analyzed: bstod de dkyil 'khor du gzhug bya //
translated: Having praised him, he should be admitted into the mandala.

original: de nas dus kyi mchod pa yis //
analyzed: de nas dus kyi mchod pa yis //
translated: Then, with the worship of the time,

original: bde chen yang dag mchod nas ni //
analyzed: bde chen yang dag mchod nas ni //
translated: having made perfect worship of great bliss,

original: rdo rje bzung nas dbang bskur phyir //
analyzed: rdo rje bzung nas dbang bskur phyir //
translated: having taken up the vajra, for the sake of consecration,

original: de bzhin slob ma 'jug par bya //🔽de la bslab pa'i gzhi @60a * //🔽lnga yongs su gzung ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin slob ma 'jug par bya // de la bslab pa'i gzhi @60a * // lnga yongs su gzung ba'am /
translated: in the same way, one should admit the disciple.🔽There, having taken up the five basic precepts,

original: dge tshul lam /
analyzed: dge tshul lam /
translated: or having taken up the novice monk’s vows,

original: dge slong gi sdom pa yongs su bzung pa'i slob ma ji lta ba bzhin du lhag par gnas par byas pas sdom pa gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pa yongs su bzung pa'i slob ma ji lta ba bzhin du lhag par gnas par byas pas sdom pa gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: or having taken up the vows of a fully ordained monk, the disciple should be consecrated by the master, having been made to stand in the proper way.

original: des kyang slob dpon la phyag byas nas //
analyzed: des kyang slob dpon la phyag byas nas //
translated: Having bowed to the master,

original: dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa pas //
analyzed: dga' chen khyod bdag ston pa pas //
translated: he should say, “Great joy, you, my teacher,

original: slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol //🔽byang chub chen po'i tshul bstan pa //
analyzed: slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol // byang chub chen po'i tshul bstan pa //
translated: you, master, please consider me.🔽I seek the great protector,

original: mgon po chen po bdag 'tshal lo //🔽dam tshig nyid de bdag la stsol //
analyzed: mgon po chen po bdag 'tshal lo // dam tshig nyid de bdag la stsol //
translated: the one who shows the way of the great enlightenment.🔽Please grant me the very commitment

original: sdom pa yang ni bdag la stsol //
analyzed: sdom pa yang ni bdag la stsol //
translated: and also the vow.”

original: zhes bya'o // de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pa'i sna tshogs pa'i gos kyis stod g-yogs byas shing /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de nas rdo rje gnod sbyin yongs su bzlas pa'i sna tshogs pa'i gos kyis stod g-yogs byas shing /
translated: Then, the vajra-yakṣa should be completely recited, and the upper robe should be made of various cloths.

original: rdo rje lcags kyu ma la sogs pa yongs su bzlas pa'i sna tshogs pa'i gos kyi gdong g-yogs dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu ma la sogs pa yongs su bzlas pa'i sna tshogs pa'i gos kyi gdong g-yogs dang ldan zhing /
translated: The vajra hook, etc. , should be completely recited, and the face covering should be made of various cloths.

original: me tog gi phreng ba dang bcas pa'i dri zhim por byas pa'i slob ma phyag bzhi la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas sdom pa 'dzin du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba dang bcas pa'i dri zhim por byas pa'i slob ma phyag bzhi la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bas sdom pa 'dzin du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The disciple should be made fragrant with a garland of flowers, and having gone through the preliminaries, such as the four prostrations, he should be made to take the vow.

original: de'i rjes la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la /
translated: After that,

original: aom sarba yo ga tsi tta au p'a da y'a mi zhes bya bas byang chub tu sems bskyed du gzhug go //
analyzed: aom sarba yo ga tsi tta au p'a da y'a mi zhes bya bas byang chub tu sems bskyed du gzhug go //
translated: he should be made to generate the thought of awakening with the words, “Oṃ, I will enter into the generation of the thought of all yoga. ”

original: de bzhin du de'i snying gar su ra te sa ma ya stvam ho badzra siddhi ya th'a su kham zhes bya bas rdo rje bskyed la /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i snying gar su ra te sa ma ya stvam ho badzra siddhi ya th'a su kham zhes bya bas rdo rje bskyed la /
translated: Likewise, at his heart, with the words, “Surate samayastvam, hoḥ vajra siddhi yathā sukhaṃ, ” he should generate the vajra.

original: de rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: de rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: He should be empowered as Vajrasattva.

original: dri dang me tog la sogs pas mchod nas yon gyi mchog blangs la rdo rje shugs kyis rang 'jug pa'i tshul du bcug nas /
analyzed: dri dang me tog la sogs pas mchod nas yon gyi mchog blangs la rdo rje shugs kyis rang 'jug pa'i tshul du bcug nas /
translated: Having made offerings with perfume, flowers, and so forth, one should take up the supreme gift, and having entered oneself in the manner of the Vajra Wave,

original: dga' ba chen po ni zhes bya ba brjod du gzhug go //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po ni zhes bya ba brjod du gzhug go //
translated: one should say, “Great joy is . . .”

original: de nas de la ji lta ba bzhin du dbab pa bskyed la /
analyzed: de nas de la ji lta ba bzhin du dbab pa bskyed la /
translated: Then, one should generate the descent of the wisdom-being just as before.

original: de bzhin du slob ma med tog dor du gzhug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du slob ma med tog dor du gzhug go //
translated: In the same way, one should have the disciple throw the flower.

original: de nas phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba de la byin nas de'i gdong g-yogs dgrol bar byas la dkyil 'khor bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phreng ba'i dbang bskur ba de la byin nas de'i gdong g-yogs dgrol bar byas la dkyil 'khor bstan par bya'o //
translated: Then, having given the empowerment of the garland to that disciple, one should remove the blindfold and show the maṇḍala.

original: de nas slar yang 'jug pa'i phyag rgya bcing du bcug nas de nyid kyi snying gar dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slar yang 'jug pa'i phyag rgya bcing du bcug nas de nyid kyi snying gar dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: Then, again, having had the disciple bind the entrance mudra, one should unbind it at the heart.

original: de nas de bzhin du de nyid rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin du de nyid rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Then, having blessed him as Vajrasattva,

original: de'i lus la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams gnas ji lta ba bzhin du dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyi sa bkod la /
analyzed: de'i lus la rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams gnas ji lta ba bzhin du dam tshig gi phyag rgya rnams kyi sa bkod la /
translated: one should arrange the pledge seals of Vajrasattva and so forth in their respective places in his body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang ji lta ba bzhin du bkod de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang ji lta ba bzhin du bkod de /
translated: Having arranged the tathāgatas in the proper way,

original: slob dpon dbang bskur ba'i cho gas yon gyi mchog blangs te /
analyzed: slob dpon dbang bskur ba'i cho gas yon gyi mchog blangs te /
translated: the master should take the best of gifts in the rite of consecration.

original: chu'i dbang bskur ba dang / phyag rgya dang / cod pan dang / dar dbyangs dang / rdo rje dang / bdag po dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba rnams kyis @60b dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu'i dbang bskur ba dang / phyag rgya dang / cod pan dang / dar dbyangs dang / rdo rje dang / bdag po dang / ming gi dbang bskur ba rnams kyis @60b dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: He should consecrate him with the consecration of water, the seal, the crown, the ribbon, the vajra, the master, and the name.

original: de nas de la dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de la dngos grub kyi rdo rje brtul zhugs sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Then he should give him the vajra observances of spiritual powers.

original: de nas me tog la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pas de yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: de nas me tog la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pas de yang dag par mchod la /
translated: Then he should worship him with flowers, etc., and with Rāga-vajra, etc.

original: gsang ba lnga'i de kho na nyid chen po'i bshad pa byas la /
analyzed: gsang ba lnga'i de kho na nyid chen po'i bshad pa byas la /
translated: He should explain the five secrets, the great reality.

original: de kho na nyid dang / chos dang / dam tshig rnams de la sbyin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid dang / chos dang / dam tshig rnams de la sbyin te /
translated: He should give him the reality, the Dharma, and the commitments.

original: dam tshig gsum gyi rdo rje'i glu'i mchod pa slob tu gzhug go //
analyzed: dam tshig gsum gyi rdo rje'i glu'i mchod pa slob tu gzhug go //
translated: He should teach him the worship with the song of the vajra of the three commitments.

original: de nas tshigs bcad lngas rjes su gnang ba dang / mna' sngon du song ba'i snying po dang / phyag rgya bzhi'i ye shes byin la /
analyzed: de nas tshigs bcad lngas rjes su gnang ba dang / mna' sngon du song ba'i snying po dang / phyag rgya bzhi'i ye shes byin la /
translated: Then, with five verses, the authorization and the essence of the prior vow, and the gnosis of the four seals,

original: gzengs bstod pa dang / lung bstan pas lung bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gzengs bstod pa dang / lung bstan pas lung bstan par bya'o //
translated: one should give the prophecy with the exhortation and the prophecy.

original: de nas ji ltar zhugs pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba dang / sngon du spyod pa byas pa'i slob ma'i cho ga dang bcas pas rjes su bsgrub pa dang / so sor rjes su bsgrub pa byin la /🔽tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor bris pa'i dkyil 'khor ram /
analyzed: de nas ji ltar zhugs pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa'i dbugs dbyung ba dang / sngon du spyod pa byas pa'i slob ma'i cho ga dang bcas pas rjes su bsgrub pa dang / so sor rjes su bsgrub pa byin la / tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor bris pa'i dkyil 'khor ram /
translated: Then, to those who have entered, one should give the post-initiatory instructions with the comforting of all the Ones-Gone-Thus, etc., and the ritual of the disciple who has done the prior conduct, and the individual post-initiatory instructions.🔽Then, in the maṇḍala of the drawn maṇḍala of the gaṇacakra,

original: lugs ma'am / brdungs pa'i lha'i sku dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs te /
analyzed: lugs ma'am / brdungs pa'i lha'i sku dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs te /

original: rdo rje dang dril bu gnyis brla gnyis la bcings te /
analyzed: rdo rje dang dril bu gnyis brla gnyis la bcings te /
translated: one should enter, binding the vajra and the bell to the two thighs.

original: des de rgyun mchad par dkrol zhing sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i don bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: des de rgyun mchad par dkrol zhing sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i don bsgom par bya'o //
translated: With that, one should continuously ring the bell and meditate on the meaning of the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: slar yang g-yas pa'i rol mo dang bcas pa'i rdo rje dang dril bu dang ldan pa'i bi wang la sogs pa dang ; de kho na nyid kyi glu dang bcas pa'i yi ge h'um gi glus rjes su bsgrub par byas pa'i snod du gyur pa'i slob ma'i cho gas rjes su bsgrub pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gzhag par byas la /
analyzed: slar yang g-yas pa'i rol mo dang bcas pa'i rdo rje dang dril bu dang ldan pa'i bi wang la sogs pa dang ; de kho na nyid kyi glu dang bcas pa'i yi ge h'um gi glus rjes su bsgrub par byas pa'i snod du gyur pa'i slob ma'i cho gas rjes su bsgrub pa'i rnal 'byor gyis gzhag par byas la /
translated: Again, with the right-hand gesture and the vajra and bell, with the lute and so forth, and with the song of reality, with the song of the syllable hūṃ, having performed the subsequent accomplishment, one should place the disciple who has become a suitable vessel for the subsequent accomplishment through the yoga of the subsequent accomplishment rite.

original: slob ma'i tshogs dang lhan cig tu dkyil 'khor bskor ba lta bu'i gar byas la /
analyzed: slob ma'i tshogs dang lhan cig tu dkyil 'khor bskor ba lta bu'i gar byas la /

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor bas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gdong brnyan rang gi gdong la bgos la /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor bas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i gdong brnyan rang gi gdong la bgos la /
translated: With the yoga of Vajrasattva and so forth, having placed the mask of Vajrasattva and so forth on one’s face,

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rgyan rnams kyis bdag nyid yang dag par brgyan la /

analyzed: de'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i phyag rgya sna tshogs kyis mchod par bya ba yin no //
translated: One should make offerings with various mudras endowed with that yoga.

original: dang por re zhig rgyal mtshan gyi ming can gyi rjes su sgrub pa pos gnas gang du rdo rje sems dpa' bzhugs pa dang / ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: dang por re zhig rgyal mtshan gyi ming can gyi rjes su sgrub pa pos gnas gang du rdo rje sems dpa' bzhugs pa dang / ji lta bu yin /

original: ci mdzad ces bya ba dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci mdzad ces bya ba dri bar bya'o //
translated: What does he do?”

original: de nas sgrub pa pos /
analyzed: de nas sgrub pa pos /
translated: Then the practitioner,

original: dngos grub kun gyi bde ba nyams dga' ba'i //
analyzed: dngos grub kun gyi bde ba nyams dga' ba'i //
translated: with the song of invocation, which is the offering,

original: thar pa'i grong du bcom ldan bde chen 'jug / mchog tu bde ba dam pa'i @61a * //
analyzed: thar pa'i grong du bcom ldan bde chen 'jug / mchog tu bde ba dam pa'i @61a * //
translated: should say, “The Bhagavān, the great bliss, enters the city of liberation,🔽which is the delight of the bliss of all powers.

original: dngos grub kyis //
analyzed: dngos grub kyis //
translated: By the power of the supreme bliss,

original: dza: h'um bam ho: rab tu grub par mdzod //🔽ces bya ba'i 'jug pa'i glu'i mchod pa dang bcas pas bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: rab tu grub par mdzod // ces bya ba'i 'jug pa'i glu'i mchod pa dang bcas pas bya ba yin no //
translated: jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, be accomplished!”

original: de nas rdo rje slob dpon gyis brtsams pa dang / rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa'i ji ltar rtogs pa'i phyag rgya sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i glu'i mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje slob dpon gyis brtsams pa dang / rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa'i ji ltar rtogs pa'i phyag rgya sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i glu'i mchod pa bya'o //
translated: Then the vajra master should begin, and with the offering of various mudras taught in other tantras and with the offering of songs in accordance with them,

original: de nas slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis /
translated: then the master,🔽with the song of the offering of praise,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang ba che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsang ba che //
translated: should say, “The great secret of all buddhas,

original: dam tshig mchod ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig mchod ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: The pledge offering is the practice.

original: zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Up to:

original: ji srid gsang ba mchog ces bya ba'i bar gyis gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gtam bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ji srid gsang ba mchog ces bya ba'i bar gyis gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gtam bya ba yin no //
translated: The discourse on the secret mandala is up to the words “the supreme secret.”

original: dkyil 'khor gzhan du rab tu 'jug pa'i glu'i mchod pa byas la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gzhan du rab tu 'jug pa'i glu'i mchod pa byas la /
translated: Having made the offering of the song of entry into the other mandalas,

analyzed: dang po sbyor ba dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog gi ting nge 'dzin ston par byed pa'o // de nas dang po'i gnas nyams dga' //
translated: he teaches the samādhi of the first union and the supreme royal maṇḍala.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtam bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtam bya ba yin no //
translated: Then, the discourse is “the first place is delightful,” and so on.

original: rang gi mtshan ma bzung ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan ma bzung ste /
translated: Having taken up one’s own symbol,

original: don gyi tshul gyis lha'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la snying po brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: don gyi tshul gyis lha'i phyag rgya chen po bcings la snying po brjod par bya'o //
translated: one should recite the essence mantra in the manner of the meaning.

original: de ltar 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pas rang gi lha'i gtam gyis phyag mtshan blangs te don gyi tshul sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags rdo rje ma la sogs pas rang gi lha'i gtam gyis phyag mtshan blangs te don gyi tshul sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In that way, Rāgavajrā and so on take up their own deity’s symbol with the discourse of their own deity and give the meaning.

original: phyi nas rang gi phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
analyzed: phyi nas rang gi phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
translated: Afterward, one should bind one’s own great seal

original: rang gi lha'i snying po bzlas la de nas slob dpon gyis dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lha'i snying po bzlas la de nas slob dpon gyis dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Reciting the essence mantra of one’s deity, then the master should meditate on the maṇḍala.

original: de nas bsgoms pas ngal na slar yang phyag rgya sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bsgoms pas ngal na slar yang phyag rgya sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa bya'o //
translated: Then, if one is tired of meditating, again one should make offerings with various mudrās.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should meditate on the maṇḍala.

original: de nas ngal bsos la yi ge h'um gi glu de nyid de kho na nyid kyi glu dang bcas pa brjod cing /
analyzed: de nas ngal bsos la yi ge h'um gi glu de nyid de kho na nyid kyi glu dang bcas pa brjod cing /
translated: Then, having rested, one should sing the song of the syllable hūṃ, together with the song of reality.

original: phyag rgya sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa byas na /
analyzed: phyag rgya sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa byas na /
translated: Having made offerings with various mudrās,

analyzed: nyi ma 'char ba'i dus su rang gi phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyis thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: at sunrise, one will accomplish all with the siddhi of one’s great mudrā.

analyzed: gal te grub par ma gyur na ngal bso zhing khrus la sogs pa byas la zla ba gcig gi bar du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: If one does not accomplish it, one should rest, bathe, and so on, and meditate for one month.

original: mthar nya la mtshan thog thag ngal bso zhing phyag rgya sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa'i sbyor bas bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: mthar nya la mtshan thog thag ngal bso zhing phyag rgya sna tshogs pa'i mchod pa'i sbyor bas bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: In the end, on the full moon, one should practice the whole night, resting, and accomplishing with the yoga of making offerings with various mudrās.

original: de nas nyi ma 'char ba'i dus su bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa byon te tshogs dang bcas pa'i sgrub pa po'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi rdo rje la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma 'char ba'i dus su bcom ldan 'das 'khor dang bcas pa byon te tshogs dang bcas pa'i sgrub pa po'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi rdo rje la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Then, at sunrise, the Blessed One, together with the retinue, enters the body, speech, and mind vajras of the practitioner together with the assembly.

original: de nas dpal rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de nas dpal rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Then one becomes glorious Vajrasattva himself.

original: dpal mchog dang po ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dpal mchog dang po ni bshad zin to //
translated: The glorious Supreme Original is explained.

original: de la de bzhin @61b gshegs pa thams cad ni byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can te /🔽de dag gi dpal dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor lha mo bzhi dang yang dag par sbyor ba nye bar mtshon pa gang yin pa de'i cho ga ni rtogs pa ste de'i grub par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de la de bzhin @61b gshegs pa thams cad ni byang chub kyi sems la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can te / de dag gi dpal dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor lha mo bzhi dang yang dag par sbyor ba nye bar mtshon pa gang yin pa de'i cho ga ni rtogs pa ste de'i grub par bya ba dang /
translated: There, all the tathāgatas have the nature of the mind of enlightenment, etc.

original: sgrub par byed pa ston pa'i ngo bo yongs su rdzogs pa ni mthar thug pa gsang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ston pa'i ngo bo yongs su rdzogs pa ni mthar thug pa gsang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Their glorious great commitment maṇḍala is the secret maṇḍala of glorious Vajrasattva, indicated by the perfect union with the four goddesses. The rite of that is the understanding. The accomplishment of that, and the teaching of the means of accomplishment, is the essence of the complete perfection, which is called the ultimate secret.

original: dpal mchog dang po'i rgya cher 'grel bshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dpal dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'i bshad ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: dpal mchog dang po'i rgya cher 'grel bshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dpal dam tshig chen po'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga'i bshad ba rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the ritual of the maṇḍala of the glorious pledge of all tathāgatas from the commentary on the glorious first-spoken tantra called “The Origin of the Perfection of Wisdom” is complete.

original: // / de nas 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i ras ris kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i rang bzhin can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dpal chen po'i dkyil 'khor bstan nas da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams
analyzed: // / de nas 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i ras ris kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i rang bzhin can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dpal chen po'i dkyil 'khor bstan nas da ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams
translated: Then, in order to abandon desire through desire, having taught the maṇḍala of the great glorious one of all tathāgatas, which has the nature of the great maṇḍala of the painting of glorious Vajrasattva, now, in order to teach the maṇḍala of the secret of the tathāgatas for the swift attainment of siddhi for yogins of the tathāgatas,

original: la myur du dngos grub sgrub par byed pa de'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: la myur du dngos grub sgrub par byed pa de'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it says in the text: Then, in order to teach the maṇḍala of the secret of the tathāgatas for the swift attainment of siddhi for yogins of the tathāgatas,🔽the Bhagavān entered the samadhi called “The Vajra of the Secret of the Tathāgatas.”

original: de nas kyi sgra ni de ma thag pa rjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de nas kyi sgra ni de ma thag pa rjod par byed pa ste /
translated: The word “then” expresses immediacy.

original: dang po sbyor ba 'das ma thag pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: dang po sbyor ba 'das ma thag pa nyid du'o //
translated: First, immediately after the performance.

original: dang la rdo rje sems dpa'i ras ris kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa nyid 'dir dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: dang la rdo rje sems dpa'i ras ris kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa nyid 'dir dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: And the first performance is the samadhi taught in the Vajrasattva painting mandala.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu la'o //
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: gang gi phyir mchog tu gsang ba'i cho ga 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i zlos pa pos sum 'gyur gyi dngos grub grub par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mchog tu gsang ba'i cho ga 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i zlos pa pos sum 'gyur gyi dngos grub grub par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de'i phyir /
translated: Because by this supremely secret rite, the reciter of the Tathagata mantra will accomplish the triple success, for that reason

original: mchog ste phul du byung ba yin no //
analyzed: mchog ste phul du byung ba yin no //
translated: it is supreme, the best.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: All Tathagatas are Vairocana and so forth.

original: de dag gi dam tshig chen po gsum ni nam mkha'i khams thams cad du bzhugs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje sems dpa' dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / nam mkha'i snying po'i gzugs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa gang yin pa de'i dngos grub kyi don du gsang ba'i cho gar gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rtogs pa skabs su bab par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽dam tshig chen po gsum @62a * //
analyzed: de dag gi dam tshig chen po gsum ni nam mkha'i khams thams cad du bzhugs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje sems dpa' dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / nam mkha'i snying po'i gzugs kyis byin gyis brlabs pa gang yin pa de'i dngos grub kyi don du gsang ba'i cho gar gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rtogs pa skabs su bab par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // dam tshig chen po gsum @62a * //
translated: The three great pledges are: the pledge of the vajra beings, the pledge of the lotus beings, and the pledge of the jewel beings.🔽The pledge of the vajra beings is to bless the body, speech, and mind of all the vajra beings abiding in the realm of space with the forms of Vajrasattva, Lochanā, and so forth.🔽The pledge of the lotus beings is to bless the body, speech, and mind of all the lotus beings abiding in the realm of space with the forms of Avalokiteśvara, Māmakī, and so forth.🔽The pledge of the jewel beings is to bless the body, speech, and mind of all the jewel beings abiding in the realm of space with the forms of Mañjuśrī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and so forth.🔽The pledge of the three great ones is to bless the body, speech, and mind of all the vajra, lotus, and jewel beings abiding in the realm of space with the forms of Vajrasattva, Avalokiteśvara, and Mañjuśrī.🔽The pledge of the three great ones is to bless the body, speech, and mind of all the vajra, lotus, and jewel beings abiding in the realm of space with the forms of Vajrasattva, Avalokiteśvara, and Mañjuśrī.🔽

original: gang yin zhe na /🔽sangs rgyas dang chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na / sangs rgyas dang chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The three great pledges are: the pledge of the vajra-being, the pledge of the awareness-being, and the pledge of the seal-being.🔽The pledge of the vajra-being is the consecration of the body, speech, and mind of all the vajra-beings dwelling in the realm of space, in the form of Vajrasattva, Lokeśvara, and Ākāśagarbha.🔽The pledge of the awareness-being is the consecration of the body, speech, and mind of all the awareness-beings dwelling in the realm of space, in the form of the five exalted bodies of the Tathāgata.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rtogs par gyur pas na sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rtogs par gyur pas na sangs rgyas te /
translated: The pledge of the seal-being is the consecration of the body, speech, and mind of all the seal-beings dwelling in the realm of space, in the form of the five exalted bodies of the Tathāgata.

original: byang chub chen po'i sems kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i sems kyi mtshan nyid can gyi rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The pledge of the vajra-being is the consecration of the body, speech, and mind of all the vajra-beings dwelling in the realm of space, in the form of Vajrasattva, Lokeśvara, and Ākāśagarbha.🔽The pledge of the awareness-being is the consecration of the body, speech, and mind of all the awareness-beings dwelling in the realm of space, in the form of the five exalted bodies of the Tathāgata.🔽The pledge of the seal-being is the consecration of the body, speech, and mind of all the seal-beings dwelling in the realm of space, in the form of the five exalted bodies of the Tathāgata.🔽The pledge of the vajra-being is the consecration of the body, speech, and mind of all the vajra-beings dwelling in the realm of space, in the form of Vajrasattva, Lokeśvara, and Ākāśagarbha.🔽The pledge of the awareness-being is the consecration of the body, speech, and mind of all the awareness-beings dwelling in the realm of space, in the form of the five exalted bodies of the Tathāgata.🔽The pledge of the seal-being is the consecration of the body, speech, and mind of all the seal-beings dwelling in the realm of space, in the form of the five exalted bodies of the Tathāgata.🔽The pledge of the vajra-being is the consecration of the body, speech, and mind of all the vajra-be

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhugs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi 'jig rten gyi dbang phyug so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid ni chos so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la zhugs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi 'jig rten gyi dbang phyug so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid ni chos so //
translated: The Dharma is the Lord of the World, who has entered into the perfection of wisdom, whose nature is the four correct knowledges.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i ye shes las byung ba gzugs thams cad ston pa'i sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin ni dge 'dun no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bya ba nan tan sgrub pa'i ye shes las byung ba gzugs thams cad ston pa'i sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin ni dge 'dun no //
translated: The Saṅgha is the Nirmāṇakāya, which is the nature of the perfection of effort, which is naturally radiant, which arises from the wisdom of accomplishing activities, and which displays all forms.

original: gsum po de dag nam mkha'i khams thams cad la khyab nas bzhugs te /
analyzed: gsum po de dag nam mkha'i khams thams cad la khyab nas bzhugs te /
translated: These three abide, pervading the entire realm of space.

original: de'i phyir dam tshig chen po gsum po 'di yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dam tshig chen po gsum po 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, these are the three great commitments.

original: dkon mchog gsum po 'di dag gzugs gang gis gang du bri bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum po 'di dag gzugs gang gis gang du bri bar bya zhe na /
translated: By what form should these three jewels be drawn in what place?

original: ras zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ras zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares, “cloth,” and so on.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mchog gi gzugs can gyi dkon mchog gsum po 'di ni ras la bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mchog gi gzugs can gyi dkon mchog gsum po 'di ni ras la bri bar bya'o //
translated: This supreme form of the three jewels, which are the bodhisattvas such as Vajrasattva, should be drawn on cloth.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: go cha bcas te go cha dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: go cha bcas te go cha dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is the armor, the one who is armored.

original: rdo rje mchog gi go cha mchog la sogs pa rgyan thams cad kyis rab tu mdzes shing legs par brgyan pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mchog gi go cha mchog la sogs pa rgyan thams cad kyis rab tu mdzes shing legs par brgyan pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: It is the supreme armor of the supreme vajra, and so forth. It is well-adorned with all ornaments, beautifully adorned.

original: de'ang phyag mtshan ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang phyag mtshan ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: What are the hand implements like?

original: rdo rje mtshon cha bstod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rdo rje mtshon cha bstod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The praise of the vajra weapon and so forth.

original: rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i mde'u dang ldan pa'i mda' ni rdo rje mtshon cha ste /
analyzed: rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i mde'u dang ldan pa'i mda' ni rdo rje mtshon cha ste /
translated: The arrow with a single-pointed vajra tip is the vajra weapon.

original: de bstod pa ni gyen du 'degs pa'o //
analyzed: de bstod pa ni gyen du 'degs pa'o //
translated: The praise of that is the upward lifting.

original: rdo rje mtshon cha bstod pa dang / padma dam pa dang / rin po che chen po 'chang ba ni //
analyzed: rdo rje mtshon cha bstod pa dang / padma dam pa dang / rin po che chen po 'chang ba ni //
translated: The praise of the vajra weapon, the excellent lotus, and the great jewel bearer.

original: rdo rje mtshon cha bstod pa dang / padma rin chen 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mtshon cha bstod pa dang / padma rin chen 'chang ba'o //
translated: The praise of the vajra weapon, the lotus, and the jewel bearer.

original: mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
translated: Supreme means excellent.

original: 'dir bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: Here it will be explained:

original: ras kyi dbus su sna tshogs padma'i steng du g-yon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gyis gzhu bzung nas /
analyzed: ras kyi dbus su sna tshogs padma'i steng du g-yon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i khu tshur gyis gzhu bzung nas /
translated: In the center of the cloth, upon a multicolored lotus, hold the bow with the left suchness fist.

original: phyag g-yas pas mda' bstod pa la sogs pa brtson pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa bri bar bya'o //🔽padma de nyid du rdo rje sems dpa'i g-yas logs su padma kha 'byed pa'i tshul gyis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi gzugs 'dzin pa'i chos bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas pas mda' bstod pa la sogs pa brtson pa'i rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa bri bar bya'o // padma de nyid du rdo rje sems dpa'i g-yas logs su padma kha 'byed pa'i tshul gyis 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gi gzugs 'dzin pa'i chos bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the center of the cloth, on a multicolored lotus, one should draw the form of the Tathāgata, the nature of Vajrasattva, with his left hand holding a bow with the Tathāgata’s left-hand gesture,🔽and with his right hand drawing an arrow, and so forth.🔽On that very lotus, to the right of Vajrasattva, one should draw the Dharma, in the form of Noble Avalokiteśvara, in the manner of opening a lotus.

original: padma de nyid du rdo rje sems dpa'i g-yon logs su @62b rdo rje rin po che 'dzin pa'i nam mkha'i snying po'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i dge 'dun bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: padma de nyid du rdo rje sems dpa'i g-yon logs su @62b rdo rje rin po che 'dzin pa'i nam mkha'i snying po'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i dge 'dun bri bar bya'o //
translated: On that very lotus, to the left of Vajrasattva, one should draw the Saṅgha, in the form of Ākāśagarbha, holding a vajra and jewel.

original: de dag thams cad 'od kyi 'khor lo gcig dang / rin po che'i cod pan gyis dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs so //
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'od kyi 'khor lo gcig dang / rin po che'i cod pan gyis dbang bskur ba dang ldan pa sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs so //
translated: All of them are endowed with a single halo of light and the consecration of a precious crown, and they sit in the cross-legged bodhisattva posture.

original: gnas gang du ras la dkon mchog gsum 'di bri bar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gang du ras la dkon mchog gsum 'di bri bar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: Where is this cloth with the Three Jewels to be drawn?

original: 'khor lo de ni brtags nas su //
analyzed: 'khor lo de ni brtags nas su //
translated: Having examined that wheel,

original: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dam pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dam pa ste phul du byung ba yang dag par bris la /
analyzed: gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dam pa'o // zhes bya ba la 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor dam pa ste phul du byung ba yang dag par bris la /
translated: in the excellent secret mandala.

original: de'i dbus kyi re'u mig la dkon mchog gsum gyi ras ris bri bar bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus kyi re'u mig la dkon mchog gsum gyi ras ris bri bar bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the excellent, supreme secret mandala of glorious Vajrasattva, which was just explained, one should draw the cloth of the Three Jewels in the central square, not elsewhere.

original: de bris nas de'i rjes la ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de bris nas de'i rjes la ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: Having drawn that, what should one do after that?

original: ci rigs par ni bsgrubs byas na //
analyzed: ci rigs par ni bsgrubs byas na //
translated: Having accomplished it as appropriate,

original: sum 'gyur du ni 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: sum 'gyur du ni 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: it will be accomplished threefold.

original: zhes bya ba la rdo rje sems dpa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga ni ci rigs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rdo rje sems dpa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga ni ci rigs pa ste /
translated: The rite of the secret mandala of Vajrasattva is appropriate.

original: de las mi 'da' par dkon mchog gsum 'di bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de las mi 'da' par dkon mchog gsum 'di bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Without transgressing that, one should accomplish this Three Jewels.

original: de ltar bsgrubs na sum 'gyur du 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar bsgrubs na sum 'gyur du 'grub pa ste /
translated: If accomplished in that way, it will be accomplished threefold.

original: rdzogs shing mngon du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs shing mngon du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: is perfected and actualized.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba ni sum 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi gsang ba ni sum 'gyur te /
translated: The secret of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas is threefold.

original: de dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'chad la sogs pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i dkon mchog gsum sum 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i rdo rje 'chad la sogs pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i dkon mchog gsum sum 'gyur ro //
translated: The Three Jewels, who hold the form of Vajradhara, etc., are threefold.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa'i cho ga des rnal 'byor pa la grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa'i cho ga des rnal 'byor pa la grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that rite of the accomplishment of the secret mandala of Vajrasattva, the yogin will be perfected.

original: snying po gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di sprul nas bri bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: snying po gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor 'di sprul nas bri bar bya zhe na /
translated: By what essence should this secret mandala of the Tathagatas be emanated and drawn?

original: de la 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dgra nye bar dgod pa la'o //
analyzed: de la 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dgra nye bar dgod pa la'o //
translated: There, etc. The word there is for the sake of introducing the enemy.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs ka la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs ka la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is located in the heart.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig chen po gsum rdzogs par byed pa'i nges pa'i shes bzhi dam tshig chen po zhes bya ba'i mchog gi snying po ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig chen po gsum rdzogs par byed pa'i nges pa'i shes bzhi dam tshig chen po zhes bya ba'i mchog gi snying po ste /
translated: The essence of the supreme is the great commitment called the four certainties, which perfect the three great commitments of all the tathagatas.

original: de ston par byed pa'i sgra yang nye bar btags nas de nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i sgra yang nye bar btags nas de nyid yin no //
translated: The sound that teaches that is also designated as that very essence.

original: de yang las ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang las ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of activity does it have?

original: mchog gi dngos grub ma lus par stsol ba'o zhes bya ba la /🔽dkon mchog gsum gyi dngos grub bzung bas rigs thams cad kyis dngos grub ster bas nam chog gi dngos grub ma lus par stsol ba'i snying @63a * //
analyzed: mchog gi dngos grub ma lus par stsol ba'o zhes bya ba la / dkon mchog gsum gyi dngos grub bzung bas rigs thams cad kyis dngos grub ster bas nam chog gi dngos grub ma lus par stsol ba'i snying @63a * //
translated: It bestows all the supreme attainments.

original: po de yin no //
analyzed: po de yin no //
translated: Since it holds the attainments of the Three Jewels, it bestows the attainments of all the buddha families, and thus it is the essence that bestows all the supreme attainments.

original: aom bh'u kham zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: aom bh'u kham zhes bya ba la /
translated: Om bhuh.

original: yi ge aom ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: yi ge aom ni rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: The syllable om is Vajradhara.

original: yi ge bh'u ni rdo rje dbang phyug go //
analyzed: yi ge bh'u ni rdo rje dbang phyug go //
translated: The syllable bhuh is Vajreśvara.

original: yi ge kham ni nam mkha' ste 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'o //
analyzed: yi ge kham ni nam mkha' ste 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying po'o //
translated: The syllable kham is space, which is noble Ākāśagarbha.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rdo rje dril bu phyag rgya dang // dam tshig gsum po mchog yin te //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu phyag rgya dang // dam tshig gsum po mchog yin te //
translated: The vajra, bell, and mudra, and the three pledges are supreme.

original: aom bh'u kham du yang dag bshad //
analyzed: aom bh'u kham du yang dag bshad //
translated: Om bhuh kham is well explained.

original: sangs rgyas phyag rgya brda ru byas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas phyag rgya brda ru byas //
translated: The Buddha's mudra is made into a sign.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ltar na de nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ji srid aom bh'u kham zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pas ting nge 'dzin gnyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te ji srid aom bh'u kham zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pas ting nge 'dzin gnyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, from then up to om bhuh kham, the two samadhis are taught.

original: de nas 'dus pa sngon du 'gro bas gsum pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'dus pa sngon du 'gro bas gsum pa shes par bya'o //
translated: Then, preceded by the assembly, the third [samadhi] should be known.

original: dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pas 'dir bzlas pa dang / bsgom pa bya ba yin no zhes cho ga 'di rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dam tshig dang dbang bskur ba thob pas 'dir bzlas pa dang / bsgom pa bya ba yin no zhes cho ga 'di rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having obtained the pledges and empowerment, here the recitation and meditation should be done. In order to fully teach this rite,

original: khyim mam zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyis las kyi cho ga dang / slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas par gsungs te /
analyzed: khyim mam zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyis las kyi cho ga dang / slob ma gzhug pa la sogs pa'i cho ga rgyas par gsungs te /
translated: house and so on are taught in detail by the master's ritual actions and the ritual of inducting the disciple and so on.

original: khyim zhes bya ba ni rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: khyim zhes bya ba ni rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: House is well known.

original: nags tshal zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i rigs can gyi shing drung gi tshogs so //
analyzed: nags tshal zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'i rigs can gyi shing drung gi tshogs so //
translated: The “forest” is a collection of trees of various species.

original: de dag 'dir dpal rdo rje sems dpa' gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho gas nye bar mdzes shing yang dag par brgyan la /
analyzed: de dag 'dir dpal rdo rje sems dpa' gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho gas nye bar mdzes shing yang dag par brgyan la /
translated: They are here beautified and adorned with the secret maṇḍala ritual of glorious Vajrasattva.

original: snga ma bzhin du dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i ras ris kyi cho gas rang 'jug pa'i cho ga thams cad dang / slob ma gzhug pa'i cho ga rjes su spyad la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i ras ris kyi cho gas rang 'jug pa'i cho ga thams cad dang / slob ma gzhug pa'i cho ga rjes su spyad la /
translated: As before, with the ritual of the painting of glorious Vajrasattva, one should perform all the rituals of one’s own entrance and the ritual of the disciples’ entrance.

original: mchog gi mtshon cha'i cho gas thams cad byas nas /
analyzed: mchog gi mtshon cha'i cho gas thams cad byas nas /
translated: Having performed everything with the ritual of the supreme weapon,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rigs lnga'i bshad pa byas la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rigs lnga'i bshad pa byas la /
translated: one should explain the five families of all the tathāgatas.

original: 'di brjod pas te slob ma rnams la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di brjod pas te slob ma rnams la bstan par bya'o //
translated: Having said this, one should teach the disciples.

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la de nyid ni dngos po'i rigs pas bdud bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba'i bcom ldan 'das rnams yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa la de nyid ni dngos po'i rigs pas bdud bzhi las rnam par rgyal ba'i bcom ldan 'das rnams yin no //
translated: “Thatness” and so forth. Thatness is the blessed ones who are victorious over the four māras by means of the reasoning of entities.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don du'o //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don du'o //
translated: The word “ni” has the meaning of “because.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / nam mkha'i snying po rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / nam mkha'i snying po rnams te /
translated: The bodhisattvas are Vajrasattva, Lokesvara, and Akasagarbha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The Buddhas, the Transcendent Destroyers, the Tathagatas, are of the nature of Vairocana, Akshobhya, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyon @63b mongs pa dang / lha'i bu dang / phung po dang / 'chi ba dag gi bdud bcom par mdzad na bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyon @63b mongs pa dang / lha'i bu dang / phung po dang / 'chi ba dag gi bdud bcom par mdzad na bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: Since the Tathagatas have destroyed the demons of the defilements, of the son of gods, of the aggregates, and of death, they are the Destroyers.

original: de'i phyir 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa dang bral bas 'khor ba'i phyi ma'i mthar thug gi bar du rtag tu rdo rje 'chang dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i snying po'i gzugs 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa dang bral bas 'khor ba'i phyi ma'i mthar thug gi bar du rtag tu rdo rje 'chang dang / 'jig rten dbang phyug dang / byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i snying po'i gzugs 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because he is free from the demon of death, etc., he always takes on the form of Vajradhara, of Lokeśvara, and of the Bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha, until the end of the future of saṃsāra.

original: de dag ci mdzad ce na /
analyzed: de dag ci mdzad ce na /
translated: What do they do?

original: lta ngan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lta ngan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to those who have bad views, etc.

original: 'khor ba la rtag pa'i 'du shes can gang yin pa de ni lta ba ngan pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor ba la rtag pa'i 'du shes can gang yin pa de ni lta ba ngan pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams so //
translated: Those who have the notion of permanence in saṃsāra are sentient beings who have bad views.

original: de dag gi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang bral bar mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to free them from the notion of permanence,

original: sh'akya'i rigs la sogs pa'i skye ba yongs su bzhes pa mdzad nas sprul ba'i sku yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen pos ton par mdzad do //
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs la sogs pa'i skye ba yongs su bzhes pa mdzad nas sprul ba'i sku yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen pos ton par mdzad do //
translated: he takes on births in the Śākya lineage, etc., and then passes into the great nirvāṇa with his emanation body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus ni ma yin no //
translated: But not with his enjoyment body.

original: rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs kyis lta ba ngan pa dang ldan ba rnams la phan pa'i don du rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i gzugs 'dzin cing mya ngan las 'das pa ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs kyis lta ba ngan pa dang ldan ba rnams la phan pa'i don du rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i gzugs 'dzin cing mya ngan las 'das pa ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: In the form of Bodhisattvas such as Vajradhara, he shows Nirvana for the sake of helping those who have bad views, and he takes on the form of Vajradhara, etc.

original: ma lus pa ni sems can gyi khams thams cad de /
analyzed: ma lus pa ni sems can gyi khams thams cad de /
translated: The whole realm of sentient beings is the totality of the realms of sentient beings.

original: de 'dul ba dang lung dang rtogs pa la rab tu bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dul ba dang lung dang rtogs pa la rab tu bzhag pa'o //
translated: It is the establishment of those to be trained in the scriptures and realizations.

original: de'i don du brtson pa ni spro ba'i brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: de'i don du brtson pa ni spro ba'i brtson 'grus te /
translated: Exertion for that is the exertion of enthusiasm.

original: der brtan pa'i nges pa ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: der brtan pa'i nges pa ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The certainty of firmness in that is the indivisible intuition.

original: des go cha dang bcas pa ni sems can gyi don du go cha dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: des go cha dang bcas pa ni sems can gyi don du go cha dang ldan pa'o //
translated: With that, he is armored, being armored for the sake of sentient beings.

original: shin tu srid pa la gnas pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu srid pa la gnas pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: He is well established in existence, in the Nirvana that is not a place.

original: de nyid mchog ste phul du byung ba'i go cha la sogs pa gang yin pa bgos pa de ni shin tu srid pa'i gnas mchog gi go cha la sogs pa bgos pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mchog ste phul du byung ba'i go cha la sogs pa gang yin pa bgos pa de ni shin tu srid pa'i gnas mchog gi go cha la sogs pa bgos pa'o //

analyzed: dkon mchog gsum nyid nye bar 'gro ba ni thob pa'o //
translated: What is the approach to the Three Jewels?🔽The Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.🔽What is the nature of the Three Jewels?🔽The Buddha is the one who has the best armor, etc.🔽The phrase “and so on” is meant to include the diadem, earrings, bracelets, armlets, and so on.🔽The “approach” to the Three Jewels is the attainment of them.

analyzed: dkon mchog gsum nyid nye bar 'gro bde gang yin zhe na /

analyzed: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun rnams //
translated: The Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.🔽What is the nature of the Three Jewels?🔽The Buddha is the one who has the best armor, etc.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” is meant to include the diadem, earrings, bracelets, armlets, and so on.🔽The “approach” to the Three Jewels is the attainment of them.

analyzed: de dag la ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the approach to the Three Jewels?🔽The Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.🔽What is the nature of the Three Jewels?🔽The Buddha is the one who has the best armor, etc.

original: shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase “and so on” is meant to include the diadem, earrings, bracelets, armlets, and so on.🔽The “approach” to the Three Jewels is the attainment of them.🔽What is the approach to the Three Jewels?🔽The Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.🔽What is the nature of the Three Jewels?🔽The Buddha is the one who has the best armor, etc.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bskyed pa ni shin tu srid pa grub pas te /
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bskyed pa ni shin tu srid pa grub pas te /
translated: The phrase “and so on” is meant to include the diadem, earrings, bracelets, armlets, and so on.🔽The “approach” to the Three Jewels is the attainment of them.

original: de nyid rnam par dag pa'i @64a * //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par dag pa'i @64a * //
translated: What is the approach to

original: dpal ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i dkon mchog gsum gyi rang bzhin can gyi mdangs gang yin pa de dag gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i dkon mchog gsum gyi rang bzhin can gyi mdangs gang yin pa de dag gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Glory is the radiance of the nature of the Three Jewels, free from the stains of afflictions together with their traces, which is perfected in the mind-streams of disciples.

original: rnam par dag pa'i dpal mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dpal mdzad pa yin no //
translated: It is the performance of the glory of purity.

original: mchog ni phul du byung ba ste rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa de dag yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mchog ni phul du byung ba ste rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa de dag yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Supreme is the best, which are the Tathagatas of the nature of Vajradhara and so forth.

original: de kho na nyid 'di brjod pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid 'di brjod pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is this reality that is expressed?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog ni gsang ba'i rdo rje'o zhes bya ba la rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag med dang / don yod grub pa rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchog ni gsang ba'i rdo rje'o zhes bya ba la rnam par snang mdzad dang / mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag med dang / don yod grub pa rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
translated: The supreme of all Tathagatas is the Secret Vajra. Vairochana, Akshobhya, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, and Amoghasiddhi are all the Tathagatas.

original: de rnams kyi mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
translated: Their supreme is the best.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa gnyis su med pa'i thugs rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir gsang ba'i rdo rje de nyid yin no //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa gnyis su med pa'i thugs rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir gsang ba'i rdo rje de nyid yin no //
translated: The secret vajra is that very nature of self-awareness, which is non-dual, without beginning or end.

original: 'dis ni 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur ro ;
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: / rdo rje'i don 'di mngon du byas shing de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdo rje blangs te gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: / rdo rje'i don 'di mngon du byas shing de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rnal 'byor pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdo rje blangs te gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Having realized this vajra meaning, the practitioner of the Tathāgata family should take up the Tathāgata’s vajra and hold it.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdo rje de kho na nyid kyis gzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdo rje de kho na nyid kyis gzung ste /
translated: Having thus taken up the Tathāgata’s vajra with reality,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dril bu chos kyi dril bu dkrol cig ces bya ba'i cho gas 'di rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dril bu chos kyi dril bu dkrol cig ces bya ba'i cho gas 'di rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate this with the ritual of “Ring the Dharma bell of the Tathāgatas,”

original: de nas mchog tu gsang ba'i chos nyid kyi dril bu'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas mchog tu gsang ba'i chos nyid kyi dril bu'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: then the supreme secret Dharma-nature bell is stated.

original: de nas kyi sgras ni skabs la bab pa'o //
analyzed: de nas kyi sgras ni skabs la bab pa'o //
translated: The word “then” indicates the appropriate occasion.

original: mchog tu gsang ba'i chos nyid ni sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i shes rab po //
analyzed: mchog tu gsang ba'i chos nyid ni sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i shes rab po //
translated: The supreme secret Dharma-nature is the wisdom that accords with sound.

original: de ston par byed pa'i phyag rgya ni dril bu'o //🔽thams cad nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i phyag rgya ni dril bu'o // thams cad nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can //
translated: The mudra that reveals this is the bell.🔽All things have the nature of space.

original: zhes bya ba la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po thams cad don dam par nam mkha'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po thams cad don dam par nam mkha'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: All things, compounded and uncompounded, have the nature of space in the ultimate.

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin 'di lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin 'di lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of space?

original: nam mkha' yang ni mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: nam mkha' yang ni mtshan nyid med //
translated: Space is without characteristics.

original: ces bya ba la rdzas thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid can ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la rdzas thams cad med pa'i mtshan nyid can ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The nature of space is the absence of all substances.

original: ji ltar nam mkha'i mtshan nyid med pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang mtshan nyid med pa yin no zhes bya ba yang gi sgras ni ston pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha'i mtshan nyid med pa de bzhin du dngos po thams cad kyang mtshan nyid med pa yin no zhes bya ba yang gi sgras ni ston pa yin te /
translated: Just as space is without characteristics, so all things are without characteristics. The word “also” indicates that space is without characteristics.

original: don dam par chos thams cad gdong ma nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir @64b ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad gdong ma nas ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir @64b ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that ultimately all things are by nature primordially unborn.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The equality with space is thusness.

original: de'i sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de bzhin nyid ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de bzhin nyid ro gcig pa'o //
translated: Its application is the yogi's mind and mental factors, which are of one taste with suchness.

original: rgyu de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor pa des kun mchog mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor pa des kun mchog mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: For that very reason, the yogi's equality of the supreme among all is suchness.

original: de la gsal ni khyab par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gsal ni khyab par gyur pa yin no //
translated: In that, clarity is pervasion.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is so-called.

original: sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i shes rab kyis nam mkha'i dang mnyam pa nyid du khyab par rnal 'byor pas thob pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sgra'i rjes su 'gro ba'i shes rab kyis nam mkha'i dang mnyam pa nyid du khyab par rnal 'byor pas thob pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The yogi's attainment of pervasion with the wisdom that accords with sound, equal to space, is the perfection of wisdom.

original: lhag par mos pa 'dis rnal 'byor bas dril bu dkrol bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa 'dis rnal 'byor bas dril bu dkrol bar bya ba'o //
translated: By this conviction, the yogi should ring the bell.

original: 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: thams cad nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: thams cad nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can //
translated: All have the characteristic of space.

original: nam mkha' yang ni mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: nam mkha' yang ni mtshan nyid med //
translated: Space also is without characteristic.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the union with space,

original: kun mchog mnyam pa nyid du gsal //
