translated: And since that is a pledge and also supreme, it is the supreme pledge, that is, the pledge seal of the great seal and so forth.

original: ci'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje 'ching ba dam tshig mchog rnams kyi dam tshig yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje 'ching ba dam tshig mchog rnams kyi dam tshig yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the bindings of the vajras of body, speech, and mind of Vajrasattva and so forth the supreme pledges?

original: 'da' bar dka' ba'o zhes bya ba la gang gi phyir rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bcing ba 'di ni dam tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'da' bar dka' ba'o zhes bya ba la gang gi phyir rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i phyag rgya bcing ba 'di ni dam tshig yin no //
translated: It is difficult to transgress, that is, since this binding of the seals of Vajrasattva and so forth is a pledge,

original: 'di ltar 'chad par 'gyur te rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje la lhag par mos bas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku la sogs pa'i phyag @85a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'chad par 'gyur te rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje la lhag par mos bas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku la sogs pa'i phyag @85a * //
translated: it is explained as follows: By the conviction that the vajras of body, speech, and mind of Vajrasattva and so forth are the vajras of body, speech, and mind of Vajrasattva and so forth, one should bind the seals of body, speech, and mind of Vajrasattva and so forth.

original: rgya rnams bcing ba gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sems dpa' mchog mthong ba'i thabs kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rgya rnams bcing ba gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sems dpa' mchog mthong ba'i thabs kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: That very binding of the seals is the cause of the method of seeing the supreme heroes such as Vajrasattva.

original: gsang ba'i dbye bas rgyu rnams zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsang ba'i dbye bas rgyu rnams zhes gsungs so //
translated: The cause is called “seals” by way of the division of secret.

original: gang gi phyir de rnams phyag rgya zhes bya ba brjod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de rnams phyag rgya zhes bya ba brjod pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it said that they are called “seals”?🔽Vajrasattva, etc.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyi sku zhes bya ba'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ste de rnams rdo rje bzhin du mi phyed pas shin tu brtan pa
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams kyi sku zhes bya ba'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ste de rnams rdo rje bzhin du mi phyed pas shin tu brtan pa
translated: The body of Vajrasattva, etc., explained as they are, is called “vajra body, speech, and mind.” Since those are indivisible like a vajra, they are very firm.

original: ste / rgyu de'i phyir sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje de'i rang bzhin can gyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba kun du bshad pa ni bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ste / rgyu de'i phyir sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje de'i rang bzhin can gyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba kun du bshad pa ni bstan pa ste /
translated: For that reason, the explanation of the seals that have the nature of those vajra body, speech, and mind is called “teaching.”

original: lus can rnams kyis phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa thams cad grub pa'i phyir de ltar gyur pa'i phyag rgya de rnams sprul pa ni spro bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: lus can rnams kyis phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa thams cad grub pa'i phyir de ltar gyur pa'i phyag rgya de rnams sprul pa ni spro bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: In order to accomplish all, such as the great seal, for embodied beings, he emanates those seals, that is, he emits them.

original: slar yang phyag rgya de rnams kyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: slar yang phyag rgya de rnams kyi khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to teach the distinction of those seals,

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he declares, “That which is held,” and so on.🔽The practitioner who merely holds the seals, such as the great seal, by means of the imagination of the vajra body, speech, and mind of Vajrasattva, and so on, having bound them and made them manifest,

original: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje la lhag par mos pas bzung ba tsam gyi sgrub pa po rnams kyis bcings nas mngon du byas na rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs ba ni
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya rnams rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje la lhag par mos pas bzung ba tsam gyi sgrub pa po rnams kyis bcings nas mngon du byas na rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs ba ni
translated: Vajrasattva, and so on,

original: mchog ste phul du byung ba rnams bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog ste phul du byung ba rnams bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: are gathered, that is, they are included, as the best, that is, as the most excellent.

original: mchog ni dam pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni dam pa'o //
translated: The best is the highest.

original: mthong zhing mngon par mthong ba nyid //
analyzed: mthong zhing mngon par mthong ba nyid //
translated: Seeing and directly seeing

original: ces bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i phyag rgya rnams gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du bcings ba tsam nyid kyis de dag bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i phyag rgya rnams gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du bcings ba tsam nyid kyis de dag bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by merely binding the seals of the vajra body, speech, and mind in the manner of a reflection, they are included.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te gang gi phyir phyag rgya bcings ba tsam gyis de dag bsdus par 'gyur ba de'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sems dpa' rnams sgrub pa po la 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te gang gi phyir phyag rgya bcings ba tsam gyis de dag bsdus par 'gyur ba de'i phyir rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sems dpa' rnams sgrub pa po la 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The word “ni” has the meaning of “because.” Because by merely binding the seals they are included, therefore the heroes such as Vajrasattva are accomplished for the practitioner.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub nyams pas 'jigs pa ni dam tshig nyams pas 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub nyams pas 'jigs pa ni dam tshig nyams pas 'jigs pa'o //
translated: Fearing the loss of the powers such as the great seal, he fears the loss of the commitments.

original: de dag ci'i phyir dam tshig nyams pas 'jigs she na /
analyzed: de dag ci'i phyir dam tshig nyams pas 'jigs she na /
translated: Why do they fear the loss of the commitments?

original: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba rnams kyi gdu bu'i phyag rgyas rgyas btab pa'i rtags kyi phyag rgya de'i yul na gnas pa rnams kyis 'da' bar dka' bas te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor los sgyur ba rnams kyi gdu bu'i phyag rgyas rgyas btab pa'i rtags kyi phyag rgya de'i yul na gnas pa rnams kyis 'da' bar dka' bas te /
translated: Just as the seals of the insignia marked with the seal of the wheel-monarchs are difficult to transgress for those who live in their realm,

original: 'da' bar mi nus pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'da' bar mi nus pa de bzhin du /
translated: they cannot be transgressed.

original: sku gsung thugs @85b kyi rdo rje ston par byed pa'i phyag rgya de'i sgom pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bcings pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang 'da' bar mi spyod do //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs @85b kyi rdo rje ston par byed pa'i phyag rgya de'i sgom pas rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis bcings pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang 'da' bar mi spyod do //
translated: The mudra that reveals the vajra of body, speech, and mind, by meditating on that mudra, the yogins are bound, and the Tathagatas do not transgress that.

original: gal te sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i sgom pas phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bcing ba rgyal ba thams cad kyis kyang 'da' bar mi spyod pa de ltar yin pas na sgom pa kho na gtso bor gyur pa yin gyi phyag rgya'i bcing ba ci zhes
analyzed: gal te sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i sgom pas phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa bcing ba rgyal ba thams cad kyis kyang 'da' bar mi spyod pa de ltar yin pas na sgom pa kho na gtso bor gyur pa yin gyi phyag rgya'i bcing ba ci zhes
translated: If the mudra of the great seal, etc., is bound by meditating on the vajra of body, speech, and mind, and is not transgressed even by all the Victors, then meditation alone is the most important thing, and what is the use of binding the mudra?

original: bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di yin pas sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di yin pas sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: This is the thought, and so he says, “Buddhahood, etc.”

original: gang la ji lta bu'i dngos grub grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang la ji lta bu'i dngos grub grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: This is the thought, “What kind of powers are attained, and for whom?”

original: 'dod chags la spyod pa'i sems can gang yin pa de ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sgeg pa'i spyod pa gang yin pas 'dul ba de ltar gang zhig ji srid ser snas zil gyis mnan pa de ni 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying pos 'dul ba 'dis 'dul bar
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pa'i sems can gang yin pa de ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i sgeg pa'i spyod pa gang yin pas 'dul ba de ltar gang zhig ji srid ser snas zil gyis mnan pa de ni 'phags pa nam mkha'i snying pos 'dul ba 'dis 'dul bar
translated: Those sentient beings who are dominated by desire are disciplined by the conduct of the glorious Vajrasattva, who is a hero.

original: mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are dominated by miserliness are disciplined by this discipline of the noble Akashagarbha.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni ji ltar 'jig rten 'dul ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni ji ltar 'jig rten 'dul ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One who has that is endowed with worldly discipline.

original: 'jig rten ni sems can gyi khams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni sems can gyi khams so //
translated: The world is the realm of sentient beings.

original: de ltar dngos grub gsungs pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar dngos grub gsungs pa yin //
translated: Thus, the powers are taught.

original: zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what the Bhagavān has said.

original: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni dngos grub de'i thabs de thob pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya ni dngos grub de'i thabs de thob pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The mudrā of the great seal, etc., is the means for that power, the cause for attaining that.

original: de yang phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pas na dngos grub thams cad byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pas na dngos grub thams cad byed pa'o //
translated: And that is the agent of all powers, because it accomplishes the powers of the great seal, etc.

original: mchog tu phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu phul du byung ba'o //
translated: It is supreme, excellent.

original: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya gang zhig bcings pa tsam gyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya gang zhig bcings pa tsam gyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: By merely binding the mudras such as the great seal, they are included.🔽

original: bde ba chen po ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' byon te rang gi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rjer byin gyis brlabs pa brtag pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba chen po ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' byon te rang gi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rjer byin gyis brlabs pa brtag pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: By merely binding the mudra of the great seal and so on, the buddhas and bodhisattvas, such as Vajrasattva, who are of the nature of nonduality, come and consecrate one's body, speech, and mind as the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: skad cig mas zhes bya ba skad cig ma nyid du ste yun ring pos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig mas zhes bya ba skad cig ma nyid du ste yun ring pos ni ma yin no //
translated: In an instant means in an instant, not over a long period of time.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag mchog gi thabs yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag mchog gi thabs yin no //
translated: For that very reason, they are the supreme method.

original: de nas 'di gsungs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mchog gi rgyud phyi ma byin gyis brlab pa mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nas 'di gsungs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mchog gi rgyud phyi ma byin gyis brlab pa mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Then, after teaching this, the Blessed One consecrated the continuation of the supreme tantra.  This is to be connected.

original: de khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba de'i khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir mchog tu zhes bya @86a * //
analyzed: de khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba de'i khyad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir mchog tu zhes bya @86a * //
translated: What kind of distinction does it have? In order to show its distinction, it is said supreme.

original: ba la sogs te mchog ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ba la sogs te mchog ni bshad zin to //
translated: The supreme, etc. has been explained.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'gog pa la rab tu zhugs pas na mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'gog pa la rab tu zhugs pas na mkhas pa'o //
translated: It is skilled, since it is engaged in the cessation of the afflictions and secondary afflictions such as desire.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang 'jig rten pa'i lam rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pas na phra ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang 'jig rten pa'i lam rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pas na phra ba'o //
translated: It is subtle, since it is not the domain of the paths of the sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and mundane beings.

original: nam mkha'i khams thams cad du rtag tu bzhugs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams thams cad du rtag tu bzhugs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni rgya che ba'o //
translated: It is vast, since the vajra of body, speech, and mind always exists in all the realms of space.

original: nges par 'byin pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis bsam par mi nus pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis bsam par mi nus pas na bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is inconceivable, since it is by nature the wisdom that definitely delivers, and is thus incapable of being conceived.

original: mchog kyang de yin la mkhas shing phra ba yang de nyid yin zhing rgya che ba dang zab pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa de yin pas na mchog tu mkhas shing phra la rgya che zhing zab la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: mchog kyang de yin la mkhas shing phra ba yang de nyid yin zhing rgya che ba dang zab pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa de yin pas na mchog tu mkhas shing phra la rgya che zhing zab la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is supreme, skilled, subtle, vast, profound, and inconceivable, since it is supreme, skilled, subtle, vast, profound, and inconceivable.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyo mongs pa dang bral bas na mchog tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyo mongs pa dang bral bas na mchog tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: It is supremely pure because it is free from afflictions together with their traces.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The beginningless and endless has already been explained.

original: thog ma dang tham med pa nyid kyi phyir mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tham med pa nyid kyi phyir mi zad pa'o //
translated: It is inexhaustible because it has no beginning and no end.

original: de nyid mi 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi 'jig pa'o //
translated: That itself is imperishable.

original: 'dod pa'i dngos grub nges par ster bas na gdon mi za ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos grub nges par ster bas na gdon mi za ba'o //
translated: It is certain because it bestows the desired attainment.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is unobstructed.

original: de ni de ltar gyur pa gcig pur ma zad kyi shin tu phul du byung bas mchog gi chos kyi dbyings la chags pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de ltar gyur pa gcig pur ma zad kyi shin tu phul du byung bas mchog gi chos kyi dbyings la chags pa nyid do //
translated: It is not only that it is so, but it is also the supreme attachment to the realm of phenomena because it is extremely sublime.

original: ma lus pa ni rigs lnga'i lha rnams kyi bde ba chen po dang yid bde ba thams cad kyi mchog tu rtag pa dang thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa ni rigs lnga'i lha rnams kyi bde ba chen po dang yid bde ba thams cad kyi mchog tu rtag pa dang thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme of all the great bliss and mental satisfaction of the deities of the five families, which is constant, beginningless, and endless.

original: ci mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlab pa mdzad pa yin zhe na ma lus shing lus pa med pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ci mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlab pa mdzad pa yin zhe na ma lus shing lus pa med pa la sogs pa la /
translated: What did the Blessed One do to bestow his blessing?

original: rdo rje dbab pa rnams kyis rab tu sad par mdzad cing zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rdo rje dbab pa rnams kyis rab tu sad par mdzad cing zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: One should connect this with awakened by the vajra descents.

original: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sgra ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sgra ni bshad zin to //
translated: The term all without exception has been explained.

original: ma lus shing lus pa med pa yang de yin la sems can gyi khams thams cad kyang de nyid yin pas na ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad do //
analyzed: ma lus shing lus pa med pa yang de yin la sems can gyi khams thams cad kyang de nyid yin pas na ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams thams cad do //
translated: And that is all without exception, and that is the realm of sentient beings, thus it is the realm of all sentient beings without exception.

original: de'i mchog tu phul du byung ba ni thams cad kyi dam pa dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dngos grub chen po rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mchog tu phul du byung ba ni thams cad kyi dam pa dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i dngos grub chen po rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The highest, most excellent of that is the perfection of the great powers of all, such as the glorious Vajrasattva.

original: de'i dbang phyug chen po nyid ni ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid de /
analyzed: de'i dbang phyug chen po nyid ni ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid de /
translated: The state of being the lord of that is the sovereignty of Dharma over the three realms, all without exception.

original: de rdzogs pa'i phyir mchog tu mi 'gyur ba @86b ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i rigs kyi lha thams cad kyi bde ba dang yid bde ba thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gyi byang chub chen po'i sems dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang
analyzed: de rdzogs pa'i phyir mchog tu mi 'gyur ba @86b ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i rigs kyi lha thams cad kyi bde ba dang yid bde ba thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gyi byang chub chen po'i sems dang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang
translated: For the sake of completing that, the supreme unchanging is the supreme, the best, of all the supreme accomplishments, which have the nature of the great mind of enlightenment, which is the nature of all the bliss and mental bliss of all the deities of the buddha family, which is without beginning or end, and which has the nature of the perfection of generosity,

original: / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mchog gi dngos grub thams cad kyi yang mchog ni dam pa'o //
analyzed: / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mchog gi dngos grub thams cad kyi yang mchog ni dam pa'o //
translated: the perfection of effort, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: rdo rje 'bebs pa ni rigs kyi lha thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams sgrub pa po'i rgyud la zhugs pa gang yin pa de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa'i sems can gyi khams rab tu sad par mdzad cing mchog🔽gi rgyud phyi ma byin gyis brlab pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bebs pa ni rigs kyi lha thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams sgrub pa po'i rgyud la zhugs pa gang yin pa de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa'i sems can gyi khams rab tu sad par mdzad cing mchog🔽gi rgyud phyi ma byin gyis brlab pa yin no //
translated: The vajra descent is that which causes the vajras of body, speech, and mind of all the deities of the buddha family to enter the continuum of the practitioner, and by those, all sentient beings, such as the tathāgatas, are caused to awaken, and the supreme continuum is empowered.

original: de ming ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ming ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the name of that one?

original: bde ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bde ba yang yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas bde ba chen po ste rigs kyi lha thams cad kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bde ba yang yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas bde ba chen po ste rigs kyi lha thams cad kyi gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is called the great bliss, etc. It is bliss and it is great, hence the great bliss, which is the nondual intuition of all the clan deities.

original: de las byung ba'i rigs thams cad kyi phyag mtshan ni rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i rigs thams cad kyi phyag mtshan ni rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra is the symbol of all the clans that arise from that.

original: gdul bya rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub nges par rdzogs par mdzad nas de'i phyir don yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub nges par rdzogs par mdzad nas de'i phyir don yod pa yin no //
translated: It is successful, because it definitely accomplishes the powers that are desired by those to be trained.

original: skye bo thams cad kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir de mchog tu gsang ba yin no //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir de mchog tu gsang ba yin no //
translated: It is the supreme secret, because it is not common to all people.

original: bde ba chen po'i rdo rje gsang ba yang de nyid yin la mchog tu gsang ba yang de nyid yin pas na bde ba chen po'ang rdo rje gsang ba'i don yod pa mchog tu gsang bas de'i ming dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i rdo rje gsang ba yang de nyid yin la mchog tu gsang ba yang de nyid yin pas na bde ba chen po'ang rdo rje gsang ba'i don yod pa mchog tu gsang bas de'i ming dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is the vajra of the great bliss secret, because it is the great bliss and it is the supreme secret. It is the successful vajra of the great bliss secret, because it is the great bliss, the secret, and the successful. It is named after that.

original: mchog tu yang yin la mtshon cha yang de nyid yin pas na mchog gi mtshon cha ste shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin can gyi mtshon cha'o //
analyzed: mchog tu yang yin la mtshon cha yang de nyid yin pas na mchog gi mtshon cha ste shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin can gyi mtshon cha'o //
translated: It is supreme and also a weapon, thus it is the supreme weapon, which is the weapon having the nature of wisdom and means.

original: mchog tu gsang ba ni 'das ma thag tu bshad pa ste de'i cho ga ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu gsang ba ni 'das ma thag tu bshad pa ste de'i cho ga ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: The supreme secret is just what was explained immediately before. Its rite is its practice.

original: mchog kyang yin la rgyud phyi ma yang de nyid yin pas mchog gi rgyud phyi ma ste /
analyzed: mchog kyang yin la rgyud phyi ma yang de nyid yin pas mchog gi rgyud phyi ma ste /
translated: It is supreme and also a later tantra, thus it is the supreme later tantra.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin can gang yin pa de byin gyis brlab par mdzad pa ni phyi ma'i mu'i mthar thug par brtan par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin can gang yin pa de byin gyis brlab par mdzad pa ni phyi ma'i mu'i mthar thug par brtan par mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which has the nature of the continuity of the self-consecration, etc., is consecrated, which means that it is stabilized up to the end of the final limit.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de nas kyi sgra ni skabs su bab pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de nas kyi sgra ni skabs su bab pa'o //
translated: Then, etc. The word then refers to the present context.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: All the Tathagatas are the nondual mind and mental factors.

original: de dag gi dam tshig thams @87a * //
analyzed: de dag gi dam tshig thams @87a * //
translated: Their all commitments

original: cad ni rigs thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gyi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: cad ni rigs thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gyi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The nature of all the families is the seal of the Body, Speech, and Mind of the Vajra.

original: de rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi byin gyis brlab pa ni sgrub pa'i rgyud la rang gi rigs kyi lha'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rdzogs par mdzad pa ste de la sgrub pa gcig pu ni rdzogs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi byin gyis brlab pa ni sgrub pa'i rgyud la rang gi rigs kyi lha'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rdzogs par mdzad pa ste de la sgrub pa gcig pu ni rdzogs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The consecration of their nature is the cause of the perfection of the Body, Speech, and Mind of the deity of one's own family in the Sadhana Tantra. The sole practice is the cause of perfection.

original: de'i cho ga ni rjes su spyad par bya ba'i dngos po rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i cho ga ni rjes su spyad par bya ba'i dngos po rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: The rite of that is the teaching of the thing to be practiced.

original: mchog tu gsang ba ni skye bo thams cad la rab tu ma grags pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu gsang ba ni skye bo thams cad la rab tu ma grags pa'o //
translated: The supreme secret is not well known to all people.

original: bshad par bya ba ni 'og nas rgyas par bshad par bya ste bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas de skad gsungs so //
analyzed: bshad par bya ba ni 'og nas rgyas par bshad par bya ste bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas de skad gsungs so //
translated: The explanation is to be explained in detail below. The Blessed One, Vajrasattva, spoke thus.

original: nyin re zhes bya ba ni zhag re re la'o //
analyzed: nyin re zhes bya ba ni zhag re re la'o //
translated: Daily means every day.

original: sngon du ni thams cad dgug pa la sogs pa'i thog mar ro //
analyzed: sngon du ni thams cad dgug pa la sogs pa'i thog mar ro //
translated: Previously means at the beginning of all the summoning, etc.

original: lan cig tu ni lan cig kho nar ro //
analyzed: lan cig tu ni lan cig kho nar ro //
translated: Once means only once.

original: phyag rgya chen po ni rang gi lha'i sku'i gsang ba'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni rang gi lha'i sku'i gsang ba'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: The great seal is the secret nature of one's deity body.

original: snying po bzlas zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i snying pos mngon par bsngags par bya'o //🔽phyag rgya kun gyis rab grub pa //
analyzed: snying po bzlas zhes bya ba ni rang gi lha'i snying pos mngon par bsngags par bya'o // phyag rgya kun gyis rab grub pa //
translated: Recite the essence mantra means to recite one's deity's essence mantra.

original: zhes bya ba la rigs thams cad kyi dam tshig dang / chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po rnams ni phyag rgya thams cad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rigs thams cad kyi dam tshig dang / chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po rnams ni phyag rgya thams cad de /
translated: All seals are well-accomplished means all the pledges, doctrines, actions, and great seals of all the clans are all seals.

original: de dag rab tu grub pa ni shin tu rab tu grub pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rab tu grub pa ni shin tu rab tu grub pa'o //
translated: Well-accomplished means very well-accomplished.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i sgrub pa gcig pu'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i sgrub pa gcig pu'o //
translated: It is the very practice of the self-consecration explained just above.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor tsam byas la dam tshig sems dpa'i byin rlabs sngon du 'gro ba'i phyag rgya chen po 'ching ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor tsam byas la dam tshig sems dpa'i byin rlabs sngon du 'gro ba'i phyag rgya chen po 'ching ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the mere yoga, the self-consecration alone, which has the characteristic of binding the great seal preceded by the consecration of the pledge-being,🔽now, in order to teach the yoga with signs, the verse beginning Then, in the center of the air, etc. is stated.

original: da ni rjes su rnal 'byor ston par byed pa'i thams cad dgug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dam tshig gsum blang ba'i mthar thug pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa gnyis pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba
analyzed: da ni rjes su rnal 'byor ston par byed pa'i thams cad dgug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dam tshig gsum blang ba'i mthar thug pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa gnyis pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the second practice of the self-consecration that culminates in the taking of the three pledges whose nature is the summoning of all, etc., for the sake of teaching the subsequent yoga, he states thereupon, etc.

original: la sogs pa gsungs te de nas kyi sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: la sogs pa gsungs te de nas kyi sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The word thereupon has the same meaning as before.

original: mchog kyang yin la gsang ba yang yin pas mchog tu gsang ba ste thams cad kyang dgug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyis bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga ste /
analyzed: mchog kyang yin la gsang ba yang yin pas mchog tu gsang ba ste thams cad kyang dgug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyis bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga ste /
translated: Since it is supreme and secret, it is supremely secret, and it is the rite of self-consecration whose nature is the summoning of all, etc.

original: sngar bshad pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa las kyang 'di mchog tu grub pas na shin tu mchog tu grub pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa las kyang 'di mchog tu grub pas na shin tu mchog tu grub pa'o //
translated: Since this is supreme among the practices of the self-consecration alone, as previously explained, it is the supreme of the supreme.

original: lan cig ni lan cig tu phyi'i dkyil 'khor @87b gyi khang pa dang sngags dang phyag rgya dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i rang gi lha'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa de ni dam tshig gsum gyi shin tu gsang ba'i mchog gi khang pa ste /
analyzed: lan cig ni lan cig tu phyi'i dkyil 'khor @87b gyi khang pa dang sngags dang phyag rgya dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i rang gi lha'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa de ni dam tshig gsum gyi shin tu gsang ba'i mchog gi khang pa ste /
translated: Once is the single time, and the house of the outer mandala and the mantra and mudra that are thoroughly examined is the mandala of one's deity, which is the house of the supreme secret of the three sacred commitments.

original: mdun du gnas pa de ltar rdo rje sogs thob bzung ba yis //
analyzed: mdun du gnas pa de ltar rdo rje sogs thob bzung ba yis //
translated: In front, the vajra and so on are held,

original: rdo rje can rang gi lha'i rang bzhin gyis yang dag par byin gyis brlab par 'gyur te rang gis sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i rang bzhin can du mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje can rang gi lha'i rang bzhin gyis yang dag par byin gyis brlab par 'gyur te rang gis sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i rang bzhin can du mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and the vajra holder is blessed by the nature of one's deity, which means that one's body, speech, and mind are made to have the nature of the vajra.

original: de ltar rjes su rnal 'byor ston par byed pa'i thams cad dgug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi ye shes sems dpa' gcig pu sgrub par byed pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa gsum pa bstan nas //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su rnal 'byor ston par byed pa'i thams cad dgug pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi ye shes sems dpa' gcig pu sgrub par byed pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa gsum pa bstan nas //
translated: Thus, having taught the subsequent yoga, the single self-consecration of the single sattva of gnosis that has the nature of summoning and so on, the third practice is taught.

original: da ni rang gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las gsungs pa'i rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor sngon du 'gro ba'i thams cad kyis ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyis bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub
analyzed: da ni rang gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor chen po las gsungs pa'i rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor sngon du 'gro ba'i thams cad kyis ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyis bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub
translated: Now, all of them, having first performed the yoga of their own special deity as taught in the great maṇḍala of their own family, should perform the self-empowerment with the characteristics of the great yoga as explained above.🔽

original: pa gsum pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa gsum pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the third practice, the practice of the sole consecration, which has the nature of the great yoga as explained, preceded by the yoga of one’s own special deity from the great maṇḍala of one’s own family,🔽it is said, “Then, the supreme secret…” and so on.

original: de nas mchog tu gsang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te de nas kyi sgra ni snga ma yin no //🔽mchog kyang yin la gsang ba yang de nyid yin pas na mchog tu gsang ba ste 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de nas mchog tu gsang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te de nas kyi sgra ni snga ma yin no // mchog kyang yin la gsang ba yang de nyid yin pas na mchog tu gsang ba ste 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The word “then” is a previous [word].🔽Since it is supreme and secret, it is the supreme secret, the special practice of the sole consecration that was just explained.

original: de las kyang 'di dam pa yin pas na shin tu mchog tu gsang ba'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de las kyang 'di dam pa yin pas na shin tu mchog tu gsang ba'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa'i cho ga rgyas pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Since it is also the best of those, it is the special extensive rite of the practice of the sole consecration of the supreme secret.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mchog tu shin tu grub pa zhes bya ba la bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i khyad par snga ma ni mchog tu grub pa ste /
analyzed: mchog tu shin tu grub pa zhes bya ba la bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i khyad par snga ma ni mchog tu grub pa ste /
translated: It is called “supremely perfect,” because the previous special self-consecration is supremely perfect.

original: de las kyang 'di mchog tu grub pas na mchog tu shin tu grub pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las kyang 'di mchog tu grub pas na mchog tu shin tu grub pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa'i khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since this is even more supremely perfect than that, it is called “the special practice of the one supremely perfect self-consecration.”

original: rdo rje dril bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The vajra and bell, etc., are connected with “is transformed.”

original: kun gyi bdag nyid ni kun bdag ste thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chas kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin can gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: kun gyi bdag nyid ni kun bdag ste thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i chas kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin can gyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin can gyi tshogs so //
translated: The nature of all is the nature of all, which is the assembly of mind and mental factors, whose nature is the sphere of reality, which is without beginning or end.

original: de las byung ba'i rang gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i phyag rgya ni kun bdag @88a * //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i rang gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i phyag rgya ni kun bdag @88a * //
translated: The vajra seal of the body, speech, and mind of the deities of one’s own family’s maṇḍala that arises from that is the nature of all.

original: sna tshogs phyag rgya rnams so //
analyzed: sna tshogs phyag rgya rnams so //
translated: The various seals are the various seals of body, speech, and mind.

original: rdo rje dang dril bu dang bcas pa'i kun bdag sna tshogs phyag rgya ni ye shes sems dpa'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid kyi sku ste bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu sgrub pa dang pos rdzogs pa'i sku rnal 'byor pa gang la yod pa de ni
analyzed: rdo rje dang dril bu dang bcas pa'i kun bdag sna tshogs phyag rgya ni ye shes sems dpa'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid kyi sku ste bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu sgrub pa dang pos rdzogs pa'i sku rnal 'byor pa gang la yod pa de ni
translated: The yoga of the yogin who has the body endowed with the vajra, bell, and the various seals of the universal lord, which is the nature of the gnosis being, is the yoga of the yogin who has the body perfected by the first practice of the self-consecration.

original: rdo rje dril bu dang bcas kun bdag sna tshogs phyag rgya'i skur ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu dang bcas kun bdag sna tshogs phyag rgya'i skur ldan pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The yoga of the yogin who has the body endowed with the vajra, bell, and the various seals of the universal lord.

original: ci'i phyir 'di ltar 'gyur zhe na kun bdag ces pa la sogs pa la kun bdag ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di ltar 'gyur zhe na kun bdag ces pa la sogs pa la kun bdag ni bshad zin to //
translated: Why is it so? The universal lord, etc. The universal lord has been explained.

original: de'i phyag rgya ni de las byung ba'i rang gi lha rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa ye shes sems dpa'i rang bzhin can gyi phyag rgya rnams so //
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya ni de las byung ba'i rang gi lha rnams kyi phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa ye shes sems dpa'i rang bzhin can gyi phyag rgya rnams so //
translated: His seal is the seals of his own deities, such as the great seal, which are of the nature of the gnosis being.

original: de dag sbyor ba ni yang dag par 'dus pa ste chu dang 'o ma bzhin du rnal 'byor pa dang gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag sbyor ba ni yang dag par 'dus pa ste chu dang 'o ma bzhin du rnal 'byor pa dang gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Their union is their perfect assembly, their becoming one with the yogin like water poured into water.

original: de nyid kyi bdag nyid ni rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni kun bdag phyag rgya'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi bdag nyid ni rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni kun bdag phyag rgya'i sbyor ba'i bdag nyid dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: He who has that nature, whose nature is the yoga of the universal seal, is the yogi.

original: de'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the result of that,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: he becomes Vajrasattva himself.

original: 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te gang gi phyir rnal 'byor pas rnal 'byor chen po byas na rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du gyur pa de ni rnal 'byor chen po bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te gang gi phyir rnal 'byor pas rnal 'byor chen po byas na rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du gyur pa de ni rnal 'byor chen po bya ba yin no //
translated: This is explained as follows: Because the yogi, having performed the great yoga, becomes Vajrasattva himself, that is the performance of the great yoga.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu sgrub pa 'dis rnal 'byor pa ji ltar rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu sgrub pa 'dis rnal 'byor pa ji ltar rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does the yogi become Vajrasattva by means of this practice of the sole self-consecration?

original: grub pa'i cho ga 'di yis ni //
analyzed: grub pa'i cho ga 'di yis ni //
translated: By this rite of accomplishment,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i cho ga 'dis rdo rje sems dpa' yang dag par bsdus pa ni rang gi rigs kyi lha'i rnal 'byor chen po kun gyi mchog kyang de yin la dngos grub chen po yang de nyid yin pas
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i cho ga 'dis rdo rje sems dpa' yang dag par bsdus pa ni rang gi rigs kyi lha'i rnal 'byor chen po kun gyi mchog kyang de yin la dngos grub chen po yang de nyid yin pas
translated: In this way, by this rite just explained, one is Vajrasattva, the supreme of all the great yogas of one’s own clan, and also the great power.

original: na / kun mchog dngos grub chen po ste /
analyzed: na / kun mchog dngos grub chen po ste /
translated: Therefore, he is the supreme of all, the great power.

original: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: rang gi lha'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i dngos grub bo //
translated: It is the power of one’s own deity’s great seal, etc.

original: des dbang phyug chen po ni khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid de der byin gyis brlab pa ni /
analyzed: des dbang phyug chen po ni khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal srid de der byin gyis brlab pa ni /
translated: By that, one is the lord of the three realms, the kingdom of Dharma.

original: gang gi phyir brtan par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bdag la byin gyis brlab pa 'dis rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtan par 'gyur ba de'i phyir bdag la byin gyis brlab pa 'dis rdo rje sems dpa' nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: That consecration is firm, and therefore by this consecration one becomes Vajrasattva.

original: rab tu ni shin tu'o //
analyzed: rab tu ni shin tu'o //
translated: “Very” means “extremely.”

original: 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa'i phyir don yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa'i phyir don yod pa'o //
translated: It is not fruitless, and therefore it is not meaningless.

original: 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab par mdzad pa de nyid kyi mthu rigs @88b thams cad las byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab par mdzad pa de nyid kyi mthu rigs @88b thams cad las byung ba ste /
translated: The power of that very consecration of oneself that was just explained arises from all the clans.

original: rang nyid kyi bdag nyid bcings te grub par 'gyur ba ni sgrub pa po la rag las par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi bdag nyid bcings te grub par 'gyur ba ni sgrub pa po la rag las par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One is bound by one's own nature and becomes accomplished, dependent on the adept.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: mdor na phyag rgya thams cad ni //
analyzed: mdor na phyag rgya thams cad ni //
translated: In brief, all the seals

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs thams cad kyi dam tshig dang chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po rnams mdor bsdus pas grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs thams cad kyi dam tshig dang chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po rnams mdor bsdus pas grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: are accomplished by the concise union of all the clans' commitments, dharmas, actions, and great seals.

original: byin gyis brlab pa 'di don skyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa 'di don skyod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to move the meaning of that consecration,

original: phyag rgya thams cad rang gis rang bcings te grub par 'gyur ba yin te gcig pur ma zad kyi 'bad pa med par shin tu myur ba nyid du phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos grub rnams kyang grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya thams cad rang gis rang bcings te grub par 'gyur ba yin te gcig pur ma zad kyi 'bad pa med par shin tu myur ba nyid du phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos grub rnams kyang grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: all the seals are bound by oneself and become accomplished. Not only that, but also the powers that have the nature of the great seal, etc. are accomplished very quickly without effort.

original: sgrub pa gang gis she na las kyi tshogs kyi sgrub pa yis //
analyzed: sgrub pa gang gis she na las kyi tshogs kyi sgrub pa yis //
translated: By which means of accomplishment? By the means of accomplishment of the aggregate of rites.

original: dngos grub myur zhes bya ba la phyag rgya thams cad kyi sgrub pa'i byed par 'gyur ba des ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa thams cad rjes su chags pa la sogs pa'i las kyi dngos grub rnams de dag gis myur du grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos grub myur zhes bya ba la phyag rgya thams cad kyi sgrub pa'i byed par 'gyur ba des ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa thams cad rjes su chags pa la sogs pa'i las kyi dngos grub rnams de dag gis myur du grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The rapid powers are those of the rites of attraction, etc. , which are accomplished by the means of accomplishment of all the seals. By them, all the powers of the rites of attraction, etc. , as they are explained, are quickly accomplished.

original: rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is said because of this, etc.

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu sgrub pa 'dis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa gcig pu sgrub pa 'dis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is nothing whatsoever that is not accomplished by this means of accomplishment, the sole self-consecration.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa med pa ma yin pa de dag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa med pa ma yin pa de dag gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are those things that are not not accomplished?

original: dngos grub las dang de bzhin bde //
analyzed: dngos grub las dang de bzhin bde //
translated: The powers, the rites, and likewise the bliss,

original: zhes bya ba la de la rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i dngos grub ste de mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de la rigs thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i dngos grub ste de mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The powers are those of the maṇḍalas, etc. of all the clans; that is, their actualization.

original: rigs thams cad kyi las kyi tshogs kyi bya ba dang 'bras bu thob pa ni las te /
analyzed: rigs thams cad kyi las kyi tshogs kyi bya ba dang 'bras bu thob pa ni las te /
translated: The attainment of the result of the performance of the rite of all the clans is the rite.

original: dngos grub dang las de dag gis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba ni bde ba ste /
analyzed: dngos grub dang las de dag gis 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba nyams su myong ba ni bde ba ste /
translated: The experience of mundane and supramundane bliss by means of those powers and rites is bliss.

original: gsum po 'di dag la bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag la bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no non-attainment of these three.

original: 'di dag thams cad mi 'gyur ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med par sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad mi 'gyur ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med par sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The establishment of all of these as being without beginning or end is the establishment of the unchanging.

original: de gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag byin brlab kun sgrub pa bos //
analyzed: bdag byin brlab kun sgrub pa bos //
translated: It is because of the consecration of the self, the establishment of all.

original: zhes bya ba la rigs thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams kyis byin gyis brlab pa ni nus pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rigs thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams kyis byin gyis brlab pa ni nus pa ste /
translated: In the consecration of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all the clans, the power is the cause.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rdzogs pa'i rgyu de rnams yin pas na sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rdzogs pa'i rgyu de rnams yin pas na sgrub pa'o //
translated: Since those are the causes for the completion of the desired result, they are the establishment.

original: byed par 'gyur ba de dag ni 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i bdag la byin gyis @89a * //
analyzed: byed par 'gyur ba de dag ni 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i bdag la byin gyis @89a * //
translated: Those which are to be performed are the consecration of the self, the establishment of all, which was just explained.

original: brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa'i khyad par gyi dngos grub dang las dang bde ba rtag pa rnams sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas gsungs so //
analyzed: brlab pa gcig pu'i sgrub pa'i khyad par gyi dngos grub dang las dang bde ba rtag pa rnams sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One Vajrasattva has spoken.

original: de ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub kyi thabs su gyur pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i sgrub pa gcig pu bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub kyi thabs su gyur pa'i bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i sgrub pa gcig pu bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the single accomplishment of the consecration that is the means to the desired powers,

original: da ni mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub kyi thabs nyid kyi rnal 'byor bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos grub kyi thabs nyid kyi rnal 'byor bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the yoga that is the means to the desired powers,

original: de nas mchog tu gsang ba'i rnal 'byor thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas mchog tu gsang ba'i rnal 'byor thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then, all the yogas of the supreme secret,” and so on.

original: de nas kyi sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas kyi sgra ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The word “then” is as before.

original: mchog ni dam pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni dam pa'o //
translated: “Supreme” is excellent.

original: gsang ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Secret” is uncommon.

original: rnal 'byor thams cad kyi cho ga ni sgom pa bstan pa ste de bshad par bya ste bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas gsungs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor thams cad kyi cho ga ni sgom pa bstan pa ste de bshad par bya ste bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas gsungs so //
translated: The procedure of all yogas is the teaching of meditation, which should be explained, should be taught.

original: de la re zhig dang po kho nar zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ngag nye bar dgod pa la'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig dang po kho nar zhes bya ba la de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni ngag nye bar dgod pa la'o //
translated: There, first of all, the word there indicates the introduction.

original: dang po ni thog mar te rnal 'byor gyi sgra re zhig bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: dang po ni thog mar te rnal 'byor gyi sgra re zhig bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: First means at the beginning, the word yoga should be established.

original: yo zer ni rnal 'byor las te skad kyi byings so //
analyzed: yo zer ni rnal 'byor las te skad kyi byings so //
translated: Yo means yoga, the verbal root.

original: 'dis rnal 'byor gyi sgra sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'dis rnal 'byor gyi sgra sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: This is the establishment of the word yoga, the remainder of the sentence.

original: rnal 'byor sgra de yang rig pa dang 'brel pa la 'jug par mthong ba yin te de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir skad kyi byings kyi don 'di yang brtson pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor sgra de yang rig pa dang 'brel pa la 'jug par mthong ba yin te de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir skad kyi byings kyi don 'di yang brtson pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: That yoga word is seen to be used in connection with knowledge, in order to exclude that, this meaning of the verbal root is said to be exertion.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i skad kyi don ni brtson pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i skad kyi don ni brtson pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the verbal root of this kind is exertion, that is the meaning.

original: yo zer ni ting nge 'dzin la'o zhes bya ba'i skad kyi byings gzhan 'di'i don ni ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: yo zer ni ting nge 'dzin la'o zhes bya ba'i skad kyi byings gzhan 'di'i don ni ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: The root text has the word “yoga,” which is a different Sanskrit word, meaning “concentration.”

original: gang gis brtson pa zhes bya ba ni yul gang gis brtson pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis brtson pa zhes bya ba ni yul gang gis brtson pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ By whom” means “by what object.”

original: 'brel pa tsam gsung bar 'dod pa'i phyir rang gi lhag pa'i lha rjes su dran pa'i brtson pa ni rnal 'byor yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa tsam gsung bar 'dod pa'i phyir rang gi lhag pa'i lha rjes su dran pa'i brtson pa ni rnal 'byor yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the yoga is the effort of recollecting one’s own special deity.

original: rang gi lhag pa'i lha rjes su dran pa'i yul can gyi sems bskyed pa ni rnal 'byor pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi lhag pa'i lha rjes su dran pa'i yul can gyi sems bskyed pa ni rnal 'byor pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the yoga is the generation of the mind that has as its object the recollection of one’s own special deity.

original: 'di bshad par 'gyur te phyag rgya bteg pa'i mthar thug pa'i cho ga rjes su spyad nas de'i rjes la nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: 'di bshad par 'gyur te phyag rgya bteg pa'i mthar thug pa'i cho ga rjes su spyad nas de'i rjes la nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: This is explained as follows: Having performed the ritual practice up to the end of the mudrā lifting, after that, one should visualize a moon disk equal to space.

original: de'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'o //
translated: On top of that, a second moon disk.

original: slar yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa de nyid rang gi lha'i snying po dang bcas pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa @89b gang la yod pa de la'o //
analyzed: slar yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gnyis pa de nyid rang gi lha'i snying po dang bcas pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa @89b gang la yod pa de la'o //
translated: Then, on that very second moon-disk, one should visualize a five-pronged vajra together with one’s deity’s essence-mantra.

original: gzhan la ni rdo rje las byung ba'i rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: gzhan la ni rdo rje las byung ba'i rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: For the others, one should visualize a pledge seal arisen from a vajra.

original: de nas phyag rgya'i nga rgyal rnam par bsgoms la sems dpa' byin gyis brlab pa'i sbyor bas bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpar bsgoms nas dam tshig sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya'i nga rgyal rnam par bsgoms la sems dpa' byin gyis brlab pa'i sbyor bas bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpar bsgoms nas dam tshig sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, having visualized the pride of the seal, one should visualize oneself as Vajrasattva by the yoga of the consecration of the sattva. The vajra-yogin, with the pride of the great pledge-sattva, should meditate.

original: rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni rdo rje sems dpa' las byung ba'i rang gi lha'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag nyid rang gi snying po brjod cing bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mtshon cha ma la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas ni rdo rje sems dpa' las byung ba'i rang gi lha'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag nyid rang gi snying po brjod cing bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The vajra-yogin of Vajra Weapon and so forth should visualize oneself as having the nature of one’s own deity arisen from Vajrasattva, and should meditate while reciting one’s own essence-mantra.

original: de nas ma h'a sa ma ya satva ham zhes bya ba brjod do //
analyzed: de nas ma h'a sa ma ya satva ham zhes bya ba brjod do //
translated: Then one should recite “mahāsattva-satva-haṃ.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdo rje las byung ba'i rang gi de bzhin gshegs par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnal 'byor pas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdo rje las byung ba'i rang gi de bzhin gshegs par bsam par bya'o //
translated: The practitioner of the Tathāgata should imagine himself to be the Tathāgata, arisen from the Tathāgata’s vajra.

original: de nas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyis ni rang gi lha'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas sam yo& ham zhes bya ba'i spyi'i snying po brjod cing /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyis ni rang gi lha'i dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcings nas sam yo& ham zhes bya ba'i spyi'i snying po brjod cing /
translated: Then, all the practitioners of Vajrasattva and so forth, having formed the pledge seal of their deity, should recite the general essence mantra Om, Āḥ, and Haṃ,

original: rang gi lha'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i rang bzhin can gyi nga rgyal bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi lha'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i rang bzhin can gyi nga rgyal bya'o //
translated: and they should have the pride of being the nature of the vajra body, speech, and mind of their deity.

original: de nas sa ma ya stvam aad hi tishtha sva mam zhes bya bas rang gi lha'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas snying ga dang mdzod spu dan mgrin pa dang spyi bo rnams su bdag nyid la byin gyis brlabs nas phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
analyzed: de nas sa ma ya stvam aad hi tishtha sva mam zhes bya bas rang gi lha'i dam tshig gi phyag rgyas snying ga dang mdzod spu dan mgrin pa dang spyi bo rnams su bdag nyid la byin gyis brlabs nas phyag rgya chen po bcings te /
translated: Then, with Samaya Sattva Adhiṣṭhāna Svaṃ, having blessed themselves with the pledge seal of their deity at the heart, the point between the eyebrows, the throat, and the crown, they should form the great seal.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams kyis rang gi lha'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste 'di ni 'dir ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang bral ba'i rang gi lha'i sgom pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje rnams kyis rang gi lha'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste 'di ni 'dir ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang bral ba'i rang gi lha'i sgom pa'i rang bzhin can gyi rnal 'byor ro //
translated: One should meditate on one's own nature as having the nature of one's deity by means of the vajra body, speech, and mind. This is the yoga here that has the nature of meditating on one's deity, which is free from the entry of the wisdom-being.

original: de ltar 'khor ba'i bdag nyid kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i rnal 'byor bstan nas da ni ye shes sems dpa' bcug nas gcig tu gyur pa lhag par mos pas gser 'gyur rtsi blangs nas zangs ma la sogs pa'i khams dngul la sogs par byed pa bzhin du rdzogs
analyzed: de ltar 'khor ba'i bdag nyid kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i rnal 'byor bstan nas da ni ye shes sems dpa' bcug nas gcig tu gyur pa lhag par mos pas gser 'gyur rtsi blangs nas zangs ma la sogs pa'i khams dngul la sogs par byed pa bzhin du rdzogs
translated: Having taught the yoga that is the antidote to the identity of cyclic existence in that way, now, having entered the wisdom-being, one should imagine that one has become a single being.

original: par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba rab tu brtan par bya ba'i phyir rjes su rnal 'byor gsungs pa dang / brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi rang gi lha'i bsgom pas kyang shes rab dang thabs kyi ye shes thams cad du thogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu brtan par bya ba'i phyir thams cad kyi rnal🔽'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po gsungs pa dang / @90a * //
analyzed: par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba rab tu brtan par bya ba'i phyir rjes su rnal 'byor gsungs pa dang / brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi rang gi lha'i bsgom pas kyang shes rab dang thabs kyi ye shes thams cad du thogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rab tu brtan par bya ba'i phyir thams cad kyi rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po gsungs pa dang / @90a * //
translated: In order to stabilize the statement, “It is the transformation,” subsequent yoga is taught.🔽In order to stabilize the statement, “By meditating on the form of one’s deity, the nature of all things, animate and inanimate, one will be unimpeded in all wisdoms of method and wisdom,” the yoga of all and great yoga are taught.

original: shin tu chags pa'i bsgom pas kyang rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang thams cad rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po shin tu rdzogs par 'gyur ba nyi yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir shin tu rnal 'byor yang gsungs pa yin pa ni /
analyzed: shin tu chags pa'i bsgom pas kyang rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang thams cad rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po shin tu rdzogs par 'gyur ba nyi yin no zhes bya ba'i phyir shin tu rnal 'byor yang gsungs pa yin pa ni /
translated: In order to stabilize the statement, “By meditating on great passion, one will perfect yoga, subsequent yoga, all yoga, and great yoga,” the extremely unelaborate yoga is taught.

original: slar yang gzhan zhes bya ba la 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i rnal 'byor las slar yang gzhan ni rnal 'byor gyi rang bzhin can gyi dngos po gzhan te rjes su rnal 'byor dang / thams cad rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po dang /
analyzed: slar yang gzhan zhes bya ba la 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i rnal 'byor las slar yang gzhan ni rnal 'byor gyi rang bzhin can gyi dngos po gzhan te rjes su rnal 'byor dang / thams cad rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor chen po dang /
translated: Again, “another” means that, in addition to the yoga that was just explained, there is another thing that has the nature of yoga, namely, subsequent yoga, all yoga, great yoga,

original: shin tu rnal 'byor sgom pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shin tu rnal 'byor sgom pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and extremely une yoga. This is the meaning of “having the nature of meditation.”

original: dngo po 'di gang las shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: dngo po 'di gang las shes par bya zhe na /
translated: From what is this known?

original: yang dag par bsdu ba dang / yang dag par kun du spyod pa dang / yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i sgra rnams yod pa ste de rnams las 'dir shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag par bsdu ba dang / yang dag par kun du spyod pa dang / yang dag par sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i sgra rnams yod pa ste de rnams las 'dir shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The terms “perfect inclusion,” “perfect practice,” and “perfect application” exist, and from among them, it should be known here. This is the meaning.

original: de la 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i rnal 'byor byas la ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi lus la ye shes sems dpa' bcug ste sa ma ya stvam zhes bya ba brjod cing 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rdzogs par byas la sa ma ya stvam aa ham zhes
analyzed: de la 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i rnal 'byor byas la ji lta ba bzhin du rang gi lus la ye shes sems dpa' bcug ste sa ma ya stvam zhes bya ba brjod cing 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rdzogs par byas la sa ma ya stvam aa ham zhes
translated: Having performed the yoga just explained, one should cause the gnosis being to enter one’s body just as before, saying “samaya stvaṃ,” and having completed the maṇḍala of light, one should say “samaya stvaṃ aham”

original: bya ba dang mthar rang gi lha'i snying po lan gsum zlos shing bcug pa'i ye shes sems dpa' dang chu dang 'o ma bzhin du lhan cig gyur par lhag par mos par byas te /
analyzed: bya ba dang mthar rang gi lha'i snying po lan gsum zlos shing bcug pa'i ye shes sems dpa' dang chu dang 'o ma bzhin du lhan cig gyur par lhag par mos par byas te /
translated: and at the end repeat one’s deity’s essence mantra three times. One should imagine that the gnosis being that has been caused to enter becomes inseparable from oneself like water poured into water.

original: de ni 'di rjes su rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid can gyi yang dag par bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di rjes su rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid can gyi yang dag par bsdu ba yin no //
translated: This is the complete yoga, which has the characteristic of subsequent yoga.

original: rnal 'byor ram rjes su rnal 'byor ram rnal 'byor chen po byas la thams cad bdag yin no zhes bya ba'i sgom pa ni thams cad rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid can gyi yang dag par kun du sbyor ba ste des phyogs dang dus thams cad la khyab pa'i
analyzed: rnal 'byor ram rjes su rnal 'byor ram rnal 'byor chen po byas la thams cad bdag yin no zhes bya ba'i sgom pa ni thams cad rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid can gyi yang dag par kun du sbyor ba ste des phyogs dang dus thams cad la khyab pa'i
translated: Having performed yoga, or subsequent yoga, or great yoga, the meditation that thinks “Everything is I” is the complete yoga, which has the characteristic of all yoga. By that, one should imagine that one pervades all directions and times with

original: phyir ro // yang dag par kun du sbyor bas na kun du sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: phyir ro // yang dag par kun du sbyor bas na kun du sbyor ba ste /
translated: Because of the connection with the real, there is connection.

original: 'di ltar sgra sgrub ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra sgrub ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is the establishment of sound.

original: lha mo thams cad dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgom pa dan /
analyzed: lha mo thams cad dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i sgom pa dan /
translated: The meditation of the connection with all goddesses

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni shin tu rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid can gyi yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni shin tu rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid can gyi yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: is the result of meditation, which is the connection with the characteristic of the supreme yoga.

original: de ltar mdor bstan pa'i tshig rnams kyis rjes su rnal 'byor dang thams cad rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po dang shin tu rnal 'byor rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan pa'i tshig rnams kyis rjes su rnal 'byor dang thams cad rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po dang shin tu rnal 'byor rnams bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the subsequent yoga, the all yoga, the great yoga, and the supreme yoga by means of the verses of brief indication,

original: da ni re zhig rje su rnal 'byor rgyas par bstan pa bya ba'i phyi gang dag sbyor zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni re zhig rje su rnal 'byor rgyas par bstan pa bya ba'i phyi gang dag sbyor zhe na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: now, in order to teach the subsequent yoga in detail, he says what is the yoga of the deities?

original: @90b rjes su rnal 'byor gyi sgom pa'i 'di lha'i khyad par gang gi yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @90b rjes su rnal 'byor gyi sgom pa'i 'di lha'i khyad par gang gi yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the meditation of the subsequent yoga? What is the special deity?

original: de ltar rang nyid kyis dris nas slob ma rnams kyi khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rang nyid kyis dris nas slob ma rnams kyi khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having asked this question himself, in order to make it understood by the disciples, he says the yoga of the deities and so on.

original: gang gi lhag pa'i lha zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas pa gsungs te bsgrub par bya ba nyid du rang gi 'dod cing byin gyis brlab par mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi lhag pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: gang gi lhag pa'i lha zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas pa gsungs te bsgrub par bya ba nyid du rang gi 'dod cing byin gyis brlab par mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi lhag pa'i lha'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of that is stated by “whose special deity” and so forth.

original: rjes su dran pa bsgom pa ste de nyid rnal 'byor te ye shes sems dpa' dang gcig tu gyur pa'i lhag par mos pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa bsgom pa ste de nyid rnal 'byor te ye shes sems dpa' dang gcig tu gyur pa'i lhag par mos pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The cultivation of recollection is yoga, which is the imagination of being one with the gnosis being.

original: rjes su sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su sgrub pa ni /
translated: The accomplishment is

original: lhag pa'i lha ni gang gang gi //
analyzed: lhag pa'i lha ni gang gang gi //
translated: the application of the special deity

original: phyag rgya gang dang gang bcings pa ;
analyzed: phyag rgya gang dang gang bcings pa ;
translated: with whatever seal is bound.

original: / de dang de yi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: / de dang de yi sbyor ba yis //
translated: By that application,

original: phyag rgya de de nges par sbyar //
analyzed: phyag rgya de de nges par sbyar //
translated: that seal is definitely applied.🔽The accomplishment that is stated immediately below is the application of oneself with the special deity.

original: zhes bya ba de ma thag tu 'og nas gsung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa rjes su sgrub pa de las rang gi lhag pa'i lha dang yang dag par sbyor ba ni rjes su rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ma thag tu 'og nas gsung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa rjes su sgrub pa de las rang gi lhag pa'i lha dang yang dag par sbyor ba ni rjes su rnal 'byor gyi mtshan nyid can no //
translated: That is the characteristic of subsequent yoga.

original: grub pa ni rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa ni rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection is the completion.

original: de ltar rjes su rnal 'byor bstan nas da ni yang dag par kun du sbyar ba'i rang bzhin can gyi thams cad rnal 'byor bstan par bya ba'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dag nye bar dgod
analyzed: de ltar rjes su rnal 'byor bstan nas da ni yang dag par kun du sbyar ba'i rang bzhin can gyi thams cad rnal 'byor bstan par bya ba'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dag nye bar dgod
translated: The word “in that regard” is a particle introducing the question.

original: pa la'o // ji ltar zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: pa la'o // ji ltar zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: “ How” is the question.

original: thams cad kyang de yin la rnal 'byor yang de yin pas na thams cad rnal 'byor te thams cad kyi thams cad nyid bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang de yin la rnal 'byor yang de yin pas na thams cad rnal 'byor te thams cad kyi thams cad nyid bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'o //
translated: “ Everything is yoga” means that everything is all of it, that it is all of itself, which is the meditation.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyang gzugs 'dzin pa'i rang gi lha ni dam tshig ste /🔽gang phyir phyag rgya dam tshig bshad //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyang gzugs 'dzin pa'i rang gi lha ni dam tshig ste / gang phyir phyag rgya dam tshig bshad //
translated: “ The pledge of all things” is all things, both the animate and inanimate worlds, which are the deity that apprehends form.🔽As it is said in the extensive explanation:

original: ces bya ba rgyas par bshad pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba rgyas par bshad pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pledge is explained as the seal.

original: thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i ngo bo rang gi lha ni dam tshig ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gyi kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i ngo bo rang gi lha ni dam tshig ste /
translated: The pledge is one's deity, the essence of the reality of the conventional, which has the nature of all.

original: de'i rang bzhin can gyi sgom pa ni dam tshig gi sbyor ba thams cad kyi rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin can gyi sgom pa ni dam tshig gi sbyor ba thams cad kyi rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The yoga of all the applications of the pledge is the meditation which has that nature.

original: rgyu gang gis sgom pa de dam tshig gi sbyor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis sgom pa de dam tshig gi sbyor ba yin zhe na /
translated: By what cause is that meditation an application of the pledge?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyis kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyis kyang //
translated: Because even all the transcendent lords

original: 'da' bar dka' ba nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: 'da' bar dka' ba nyid kyi phyir //
translated: have difficulty in transgressing it.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag gis kyang 'da' bar mi mdzad pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin can gyi phyag rgya de gang gi phyir rdo rje 'chang chen pos dam tshig ces bya bar gsungs pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag gis kyang 'da' bar mi mdzad pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin can gyi phyag rgya de gang gi phyir rdo rje 'chang chen pos dam tshig ces bya bar gsungs pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even they do not transgress it, the seal which has the nature of the reality of the conventional is called a pledge by Great Vajradhara.

original: ci'i phyir @91a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir @91a * //
translated: Why is it called a pledge?

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyang gzugs 'dzin pa'i rang gi lha'i rang bzhin can gyi phyag rgya de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang 'da' bar mi mdzad ce na /
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyang gzugs 'dzin pa'i rang gi lha'i rang bzhin can gyi phyag rgya de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang 'da' bar mi mdzad ce na /
translated: All things, both moving and unmoving, are the seal of the nature of one’s own deity, which is the apprehender of form.

original: yid kyi lus ni brtan phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi lus ni brtan phyir ro //
translated: The body of mind is stable.

original: zhes bya ba la yid ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la yid ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Here, mind is the realm of phenomena, characterized by great compassion, which is without beginning or end and without objective support.

original: de'i lus ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sku dang ri bo la sogs pa brtan pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de'i lus ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sku dang ri bo la sogs pa brtan pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Its body is the form of the Tathāgata and so on, and the form of the unmoving, such as mountains and so on.

original: de nyid rdo rje bzhin du mi phyed pas na de'i dngos po ni brtan pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje bzhin du mi phyed pas na de'i dngos po ni brtan pa nyid do //
translated: Since that is indivisible like a vajra, its nature is stability.

original: yid kyi lus brtan pa nyid kyi rgyu de'i phyir /
analyzed: yid kyi lus brtan pa nyid kyi rgyu de'i phyir /
translated: The cause of the stability of the body of mind is that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang de 'da' bar mi mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis kyang de 'da' bar mi mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even all the tathāgatas do not transcend it.

original: 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i chos kyi dbyings srog chags dang srog chags ma yin pa rnams kyis byed par mi 'gyur te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro//
