analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i chos kyi dbyings srog chags dang srog chags ma yin pa rnams kyis byed par mi 'gyur te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The Dharma-element, as it is explained, is not made by living beings or non-living beings, because it is non-conceptual.

original: bdag nyid de las byung ba'i sems can thams cad kyi don rdzogs par mdzad pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i gzugs sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang phyed par mi 'gyur te de dag kyang de'i rang bzhin can
analyzed: bdag nyid de las byung ba'i sems can thams cad kyi don rdzogs par mdzad pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i gzugs sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis 'jug pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang phyed par mi 'gyur te de dag kyang de'i rang bzhin can
translated: The Buddhas, etc., who have accomplished the aims of all sentient beings through arising from it, do not transcend it, because they are empowered by their previous aspirations to enter the forms of the Buddhas, etc.

original: nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They also have that as their nature.

original: de'i phyir 'da' bar mi mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni dam tshig gi don yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'da' bar mi mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni dam tshig gi don yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they do not transcend it. This is the meaning of commitment.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rang gi lha'i gzugs de rjes su sgrub pa ni lhag pa'i lha ni gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji lta
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rang gi lha'i gzugs de rjes su sgrub pa ni lhag pa'i lha ni gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji lta
translated: The “exalted deity” is taught by the passage beginning with “whoever’s” and so on, as the accomplishment of one’s deity’s form, the nature of all things, animate and inanimate, which is the natural outflow of the Dharma-dhātu as it is explained.

original: ba bzhin du rgyas par bshad pas bstan pa de ni dam tshig gi sbyor ba ste de nyid thams cad kyi rnal 'byor yin no //
analyzed: ba bzhin du rgyas par bshad pas bstan pa de ni dam tshig gi sbyor ba ste de nyid thams cad kyi rnal 'byor yin no //
translated: That is the application of the pledge, which is the yoga of all of them.

original: da ni dpes thams cad kyi rnal 'byor gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dpes thams cad kyi rnal 'byor gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to clearly teach the yoga of all of them by way of an example,

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te dper na ku mu ta dang / autpala dang / ru rta la sogs pa'i rdzas mang po gcig tu sbyar bas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te dper na ku mu ta dang / autpala dang / ru rta la sogs pa'i rdzas mang po gcig tu sbyar bas /
translated: he says “it is like this” and so on. For example, by combining many substances such as kumuda, utpala, and saffron,

original: 'jig rten na sbyor ba zhes grags pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'jig rten na sbyor ba zhes grags pa de bzhin du /
translated: in the world it is known as “combination.”

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i thams cad kyi bdag nyid brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gyi phyag rgya rnams dang / gcig tu gyur pa'i lhag par mos pa'i rnal 'byor @91b gyis phyogs bcur sbyor pa ni yang dag par kun du sbyor pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i thams cad kyi bdag nyid brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gyi phyag rgya rnams dang / gcig tu gyur pa'i lhag par mos pa'i rnal 'byor @91b gyis phyogs bcur sbyor pa ni yang dag par kun du sbyor pa ste /
translated: The yoga of the imagination of oneness with the mudras, which are the nature of all things, moving and unmoving, just as they are explained, is the union in the ten directions.

original: yang dag par kun du sbyor ba'i rgyu des ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i thams cad kyi rnal 'byor gyi dam tshig gi sbyor ba zhes bya bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par kun du sbyor ba'i rgyu des ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i thams cad kyi rnal 'byor gyi dam tshig gi sbyor ba zhes bya bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: By the cause of that union, the yoga of all things just as they are explained is called the practice of the commitments.

original: da ni thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi phyag rgya'i sbyor ba'i rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi phyag rgya'i sbyor ba'i rang bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the nature of the practice of the mudra of the nature of all things,

original: de la ji ltar thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi phyag rgya'i sbyor ba yin na zhes bya ba gsungs te thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: de la ji ltar thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi phyag rgya'i sbyor ba yin na zhes bya ba gsungs te thams cad kyi bdag nyid ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: it is said, “How is it the practice of the mudra of the nature of all things?” The nature of all things is the realm of phenomena.

original: de'i phyag rgya ni dam tshig dang chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya ni dam tshig dang chos dang las dang phyag rgya chen po'o //
translated: His seals are the pledge, doctrine, action, and great seals.

original: rigs thams cad kyi phyag rgya de dag dang sbyor pas gcig tu gyur par lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: rigs thams cad kyi phyag rgya de dag dang sbyor pas gcig tu gyur par lhag par mos pa'o //
translated: By applying those seals of all the clans, one should imagine that one has become one with them.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sangs rgyas kyang yin la thams cad kyang de nyid yin pas na sangs rgyas thams cad de lha ma lus pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te sangs rgyas kyang yin la thams cad kyang de nyid yin pas na sangs rgyas thams cad de lha ma lus pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje'i rang bzhin no //
translated: he declares, “the nature of all the buddhas,” and so on. Since he is a buddha and all of them are also just that, he is all the buddhas, the nature of the vajra of body, speech, and mind of all the deities.

original: di dang bdag nyid yang dag par sbyor ba ni ye shes sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu gnyis su med par lhag par mos pas gcig tu gyur pa'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: di dang bdag nyid yang dag par sbyor ba ni ye shes sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu gnyis su med par lhag par mos pas gcig tu gyur pa'i rnal 'byor bsgom pa'o //
translated: The union with that is the yoga of becoming one with them by imagining that one is non-dual with the knowledge beings.

original: de yang khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is the special quality that it possesses?

original: ji lta'i dbyibs dang sku dang ldan //
analyzed: ji lta'i dbyibs dang sku dang ldan //
translated: It has the shape and body of whatever.

original: zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas thams cad la sogs pa de'i dbyibs rgyud las bstan pa gang yin pa dang / sku'i gsang ba gang yin pa de gnyis po gang la yod pa de ni ji lta'i dbyibs dang sku dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi sbyor ba'o //🔽de ltar gyur pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni las su gyur pa'i bdag nyid de rnal 'byor bzhir gyur pa'i bdag nyid la yang dag par bkod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas thams cad la sogs pa de'i dbyibs rgyud las bstan pa gang yin pa dang / sku'i gsang ba gang yin pa de gnyis po gang la yod pa de ni ji lta'i dbyibs dang sku dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi sbyor ba'o // de ltar gyur pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni las su gyur pa'i bdag nyid de rnal 'byor bzhir gyur pa'i bdag nyid la yang dag par bkod de /
translated: The form of all the Buddhas, etc., is that which is taught in the Tantra, and the secret of the body is the two of them together. He who has that is the union of the nature of all the Buddhas, who have that form and body.

original: phyi nas rjes su bsgrub par bya ba ni rang gi lha'i phyag rgya bcings nas brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rang gi lha'i gzugs su bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas rjes su bsgrub par bya ba ni rang gi lha'i phyag rgya bcings nas brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi rang gi lha'i gzugs su bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The nature of all the Buddhas is the nature of the four yogas. Having thus established the nature of the four yogas, he should next accomplish the nature of the four seals. Having formed the seal of his deity, he should meditate on himself as the form of his deity, the nature of all things moving and unmoving.

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word only is restrictive.

original: bdag nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kho na'o //
translated: It is only oneself.

original: 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i sku mdog dang dbyibs dang gdan dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rang gi lha'i gzugs su bdag nyid rnal @92a * //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i sku mdog dang dbyibs dang gdan dang phyag mtshan la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i rang gi lha'i gzugs su bdag nyid rnal @92a * //
translated: Endowed with the color, shape, seat, hand implements, and so forth of one's deity as explained above, one's own body is ascertained as just that deity through mere yoga.

original: 'byor tsam gyis de bzhin du nges par byas la phyi nas ye shes sems dpa' rang gi lus la bcug ste /
analyzed: 'byor tsam gyis de bzhin du nges par byas la phyi nas ye shes sems dpa' rang gi lus la bcug ste /
translated: Then, the gnosis being is caused to enter one's body,🔽and one should imagine that one becomes unified with it.

original: de dang lhan cig tu gyur par lhag par mos par byas la rang gi lha'i phyag rgya bcings nas dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi lha'i gzugs su bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu gyur par lhag par mos par byas la rang gi lha'i phyag rgya bcings nas dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi lha'i gzugs su bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Binding the seal of one's deity, one should meditate on oneself as the form of the deity, the nature of all things.

original: don 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir rang gi dam tshig gi sbyor ba ni thams cad kyi sbyor ba'o zhes bya pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir rang gi dam tshig gi sbyor ba ni thams cad kyi sbyor ba'o zhes bya pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach just this meaning, [the Bhagavān] declares, “the application of one's pledge is the application of all.”

original: rjes su bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'i 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i rjes su sgrub pa ste de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba'i 'das ma thag tu bshad pa'i rjes su sgrub pa ste de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The accomplishment that was just explained is the subsequent accomplishment. In order to teach just that, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: de la 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te bsgrub par bya ba'i 'dod pa'i lha ni lhag pa'i lha ste /
analyzed: de la 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te bsgrub par bya ba'i 'dod pa'i lha ni lhag pa'i lha ste /
translated: The passage beginning one should bind that and so on is stated. The deity of desire to be accomplished is the excellent deity.

original: de'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dang de lha'i khyad par de dang de'i rnal 'byor ni de'i gzugs la sogs pa'i lhag par mos bas rnal 'byor pas bcings shing phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi phyag rgya de dang de
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i phyag rgya dang de lha'i khyad par de dang de'i rnal 'byor ni de'i gzugs la sogs pa'i lhag par mos bas rnal 'byor pas bcings shing phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi phyag rgya de dang de
translated: The mudra such as the great mudra of that deity, and the yoga of that and that deity's particularities, is the yoga of the yogin through the special imagination of that deity's form and so on. The yogin should bind that and that mudra, which has the nature of the great mudra and so on,

original: rang gi las la rab tu sbyar bar bya ste gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi las la rab tu sbyar bar bya ste gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: and apply it to one's own action, not to another's.🔽 Having thus taught the yoga of all, now in order to teach the meditation in the manner of yoga and subsequent yoga, both in equipoise and not in equipoise,

original: de ltar thams cad kyi rnal 'byor bstan nas da ni rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dag gis mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rnal 'byor gyi tshul du sgom par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad kyi rnal 'byor bstan nas da ni rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dag gis mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rnal 'byor gyi tshul du sgom par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: he says, the yoga of the yogin is the yoga of the yogin, and so on.

original: de nas mchog tu gsang ba'i mchog gi rjes su sgrub pa'i cho ga rgyas pa mchog tu grub pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te rnal 'byor gyi dus dang rjes su rnal 'byor gyi dus su lus kyi yan lag la sogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang
analyzed: de nas mchog tu gsang ba'i mchog gi rjes su sgrub pa'i cho ga rgyas pa mchog tu grub pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te rnal 'byor gyi dus dang rjes su rnal 'byor gyi dus su lus kyi yan lag la sogs pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang
translated: Then, the extensive rite of the supreme secret supreme accomplishment is stated:

original: gi lha'i bsgom pa'i sgom pa ni mchog tu gsang ba'i mchog gi rjes su sgrub pa'i cho ga ste /
analyzed: gi lha'i bsgom pa'i sgom pa ni mchog tu gsang ba'i mchog gi rjes su sgrub pa'i cho ga ste /
translated: The meditation of one’s deity, with all the limbs of the body and so forth completely perfect, at the time of yoga and subsequent yoga, is the rite of the supreme secret supreme accomplishment.

original: de'i mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dbye ba sna tshogs nyid ni rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dbye ba sna tshogs nyid ni rgyas pa'o //
translated: Its extensive nature is the various divisions of meditative equipoise and nonequipoise.

original: bdag nyid ces pa ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces pa ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin gyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po'o //
translated: “ One’s own nature” is the entity of one’s own nature, which is the nature of the five aggregates.

original: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word “only” is a restriction.

original: bdag nyid kho na rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sangs rgyas thams cad do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kho na rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi sangs rgyas thams cad do //
translated: One’s own nature is all buddhas, which have the nature of the tathāgatas Vairocana and so forth.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid do //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid do //
translated: The form of a bodhisattva such as glorious Vajrasattva is a bodhisattva.

original: 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor ni rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor ni rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The yoga of the desire gods is the yoga of one's own special deity.

original: rang gi lha'i brtan pa @92b dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs gang yin pa de ni rang gi dam tshig ste /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i brtan pa @92b dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi gzugs gang yin pa de ni rang gi dam tshig ste /
translated: One's own deity is the form of the nature of all things, both animate and inanimate.

original: de dang sbyor ba ni de dang lhan cig tu rnal 'byor pa tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin can gyis sgom pa gang yin pa de ni rang dam tshig gi sbyor pa ste /
analyzed: de dang sbyor ba ni de dang lhan cig tu rnal 'byor pa tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin can gyis sgom pa gang yin pa de ni rang dam tshig gi sbyor pa ste /
translated: The yoga of one's own deity is the meditation by the yogin who is of the nature of non-differentiation together with that.

original: de nyid thams cad kyi sbyor ba yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid thams cad kyi sbyor ba yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: That is the yoga of all things.

original: bdag nyed ni bdag nyid la 'jug ste /
analyzed: bdag nyed ni bdag nyid la 'jug ste /
translated: One should enter into oneself.

original: don dam par bdag nyid las tha dad pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid ni mi dmigs pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par bdag nyid las tha dad pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid ni mi dmigs pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because ultimately one does not observe any buddha or bodhisattva separate from oneself,

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas nyid dang ni //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas nyid dang ni //
translated: one should meditate on the thought, I am a buddha, I am a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang yin //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyang yin //
translated: and a bodhisattva.

original: zhes bya ba bdag nyid kho nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs su brtag par bya ste phyi'i dngos po ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bdag nyid kho nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs su brtag par bya ste phyi'i dngos po ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, one should imagine oneself as the form of a Buddha or a bodhisattva, but not an external entity.

original: 'di ltar 'chad par 'gyur te /🔽gang gi phyir ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i tshul gyis phyi rol gyi dngos po sangs rgyas kyi gzugs sam byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs su don dam par mi dmigs pa de'i phyir bdag nyid kho na'i yan lag thams cad yongs su gang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi
analyzed: 'di ltar 'chad par 'gyur te / gang gi phyir ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i tshul gyis phyi rol gyi dngos po sangs rgyas kyi gzugs sam byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs su don dam par mi dmigs pa de'i phyir bdag nyid kho na'i yan lag thams cad yongs su gang ba'i sangs rgyas kyi
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: gzugs sam byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs su rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs sam byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs su rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since an external entity, whether the form of a Buddha or the form of a bodhisattva, is not perceived ultimately in the manner that has been explained, therefore, the practitioner should cultivate the form of a Buddha or the form of a bodhisattva, which is filled with all the limbs of one’s own body.

original: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rigs thams cad kyi phyag rgya ni phyag rgya thams cad de /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rigs thams cad kyi phyag rgya ni phyag rgya thams cad de /
translated: All the mudrās of all the spiritual clans, such as the great mudrā, are all mudrās.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin rnal 'byor yang yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas phyag rgya thams cad kyi rnal 'byor chen po'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin rnal 'byor yang yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas phyag rgya thams cad kyi rnal 'byor chen po'o //
translated: Since that is the yoga and the greatness of the yogin, it is the great yoga of all seals.

original: 'das ma thag tu bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid mchog tu gsang ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'das ma thag tu bshad pa gang yin pa de nyid mchog tu gsang ba yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which was just explained is the supreme secret.

original: 'dis ni 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i sgom pas skyon gcig gi rang bzhin kun du 'gro ba'i rang gi lha'i gzugs gsal ba'i dbye bas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam par bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di ltar bshad par 'gyur te shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i sgom pas skyon gcig gi rang bzhin kun du 'gro ba'i rang gi lha'i gzugs gsal ba'i dbye bas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi rdul phra rab dang mnyam par bsgom par bya ste /
translated: This is explained as follows: By the meditation of perfect equipoise, the form of one's deity, which is the nature of the single fault, is meditated upon as equal to the atoms of all world systems by the division of clarity.

original: de'i phyir phyag rgya thams cad kyi rnal 'byor chen po 'di yin te kun du khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyag rgya thams cad kyi rnal 'byor chen po 'di yin te kun du khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the great yoga of all seals, because it is all-pervading.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor sgom par byed pa'i mchog tu gsang ba'i rdul phra rab kyi sgrub pa'i cho ga rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor sgom par byed pa'i mchog tu gsang ba'i rdul phra rab kyi sgrub pa'i cho ga rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the extensive ritual of the supreme secret particle-subtle yoga and subsequent yoga,

original: da ni rnal 'byor thams cad sgom par byed pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽rnal @93a * //
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor thams cad sgom par byed pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / rnal @93a * //
translated: now, in order to teach the performance of all yogas, [the Bhagavān] declares “thereafter,” and so on.

original: 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor byas la brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gyi rang gi lha'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid sgom pa ni mchog tu gsang ba'i mchog gi rjes su sgrub pa'i cho ga rgya sa ba'i khyad par 'dir mchog
analyzed: 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor byas la brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gyi rang gi lha'i gzugs kyi bdag nyid sgom pa ni mchog tu gsang ba'i mchog gi rjes su sgrub pa'i cho ga rgya sa ba'i khyad par 'dir mchog
translated: Having performed the yoga and subsequent yoga, the meditation on the nature of all things moving and unmoving, which is the nature of one’s deity’s form, is the supreme secret supreme ritual of practice.

original: tu grub par shes par bya'o /
analyzed: tu grub par shes par bya'o /
translated: Here, one should understand the supreme accomplishment.

original: rang gi lha'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: rang gi lha'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor te /
translated: “The yoga of one’s deity” is the yoga of the desired deity.

original: rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor gyi rang bzhin ni ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor gyi rang bzhin ni ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The nature of the yoga and subsequent yoga is that which has the previously explained characteristics.

original: des sna tshogs ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag nyid sku gang la yod pa de ni sna tshogs phyag rgya'i bdag nyid sku dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: des sna tshogs ni brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can gyi bdag nyid sku gang la yod pa de ni sna tshogs phyag rgya'i bdag nyid sku dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He who has a body that is of the nature of the stable and the moving is endowed with a body that has the nature of the various seals.

original: thams cad rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is endowed with all yogas.

original: de lta bu cir 'gyur zhe na kun bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa la kun bdag bshad zin to //
analyzed: de lta bu cir 'gyur zhe na kun bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa la kun bdag bshad zin to //
translated: What is that like? The all-self, etc. The all-self has been explained.

original: de'i phyag rgya rnams kyang bshad zin te /
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya rnams kyang bshad zin te /
translated: His seals have also been explained.

original: de dang lhan cig tu gcig tu gyur pa'i lhag par mos pa ni rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu gcig tu gyur pa'i lhag par mos pa ni rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The imagination of oneness with them is yoga.

original: de nyid kyi bdag nyid ni rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni kun bdag phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor bdag go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi bdag nyid ni rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni kun bdag phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor bdag go //
translated: He who has the nature of that very self is the all-self, the yoga of the seals.

original: mi 'gyur mchog ces bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur mchog ces bya ba ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: The unchanging supreme is without beginning and end.

original: grub par gyur pa ni rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: grub par gyur pa ni rdzogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: The perfected is the completed.

original: 'di ji lta bur brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'di ji lta bur brjod ce na /
translated: How is this?

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rtog pa yang yin la /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rtog pa yang yin la /
translated: It is the thought of all, etc.

original: thams cad kyang de nyid yin pas na rtog pa thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ste brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi phyag rgya'i gzugs su bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang de nyid yin pas na rtog pa thams cad ni rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa ste brtan pa dang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad kyi phyag rgya'i gzugs su bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Since it is all, and it is that itself, the thought of all is Vajrasattva, etc. , abiding in the form of the seal of all things, such as the moving and unmoving.

original: thams cad du shes pa'i sna tshogs pa'i dam tshig chen po'o //
analyzed: thams cad du shes pa'i sna tshogs pa'i dam tshig chen po'o //
translated: It is the great variety of pledges of all knowledge.

original: rtog pa thams cad kyang de yin la sna tshogs pa'i dam tshig chen po yang de nyid yin pas na rtog pa thams cad kyi sna tshogs pa'i dam tshig chen po'o //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad kyang de yin la sna tshogs pa'i dam tshig chen po yang de nyid yin pas na rtog pa thams cad kyi sna tshogs pa'i dam tshig chen po'o //
translated: Since it is the thought of all, and it is the great variety of pledges, it is the great variety of pledges of the thought of all.

original: de dag dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i lhag par mos pas rnal 'byor pa de'i rang bzhin du rdzogs pa ni mchog gi rnal 'byor te de nyid kyang 'dir thams cad kyi rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i lhag par mos pas rnal 'byor pa de'i rang bzhin du rdzogs pa ni mchog gi rnal 'byor te de nyid kyang 'dir thams cad kyi rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The nature of that, which is the perfection of the yoga of the practitioner who is endowed with that, is the supreme yoga. That itself is here the yoga of all.

original: 'dis ni thams cad kyi rnal 'byor sgom ba'i rnal 'byor ba la brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin kho na rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni thams cad kyi rnal 'byor sgom ba'i rnal 'byor ba la brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin kho na rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the yogi/nī who cultivates the yoga of everything attains the fruit that is the nature of the perfection of one’s own and others’ aims, which is the nature of all things, both moving and unmoving.

original: @93b de ltar thams cad rnal 'byor bstan nas da ni dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i rnal 'byor chen po yang dag par kun du sbyor ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas slar yang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: @93b de ltar thams cad rnal 'byor bstan nas da ni dkyil 'khor la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i rnal 'byor chen po yang dag par kun du sbyor ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas slar yang gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having thus taught everything as yoga, now, in order to teach the application of the great yoga that accomplishes the maṇḍala and so forth, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then again, another,” and so on.

original: rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang thams cad kyi rnal 'byor rnams las slar yang sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po gzhan 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang thams cad kyi rnal 'byor rnams las slar yang sgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po gzhan 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the nature of the thing that is meditation, which is different from the yoga, subsequent yoga, and all yoga.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'i mtshan nyid can ni 'dir mchog tu gsang ba shin tu mchog tu cho ga rgyas pa'i khyad par shin tu mchog tu grub pa las kyang gzhan ni rjes su sgrub pa las kyang shin tu mchog tu grub🔽ba ste dngos grub thams cad sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //🔽rdo rje sems dpa' ni rang gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po ye shes sems dpa'o //🔽ye shes sems dpa' de dang rnal 'byor gyi rang bzhin bdag nyid yang dag par sbyor ba ni gcig tu gyur pa ste rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'i mtshan nyid can ni 'dir mchog tu gsang ba shin tu mchog tu cho ga rgyas pa'i khyad par shin tu mchog tu grub pa las kyang gzhan ni rjes su sgrub pa las kyang shin tu mchog tu grub ba ste dngos grub thams cad sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o // rdo rje sems dpa' ni rang gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po ye shes sems dpa'o // ye shes sems dpa' de dang rnal 'byor gyi rang bzhin bdag nyid yang dag par sbyor ba ni gcig tu gyur pa ste rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid sbyor ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of the great yoga, as it is explained, is here the supreme secret, the special extensive rite, the supreme accomplishment, and also the supreme accomplishment from the practice, which is other than the supreme accomplishment.🔽It is the means of accomplishing all powers, because it is the means of accomplishing all powers.🔽Vajrasattva is the knowledge being, the lord of the mandala of his own family.🔽The yoga of the nature of that knowledge being and oneself is the union, the single identity, the union with the identity of Vajrasattva.🔽

original: dbyibs ji lta ba bzhin du rdo rje sems dpa'i sku yang ji lta bu gang la yod pa de ni dbyibs dang sku ni ji ltar ldan pa'o //

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid kyi sbyor ba yang de yin la dbyibs dang sku ji lta bu yang de nyid yin pas na //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid kyi sbyor ba yang de yin la dbyibs dang sku ji lta bu yang de nyid yin pas na //
translated: That is the yoga of the nature of Vajrasattva, and that is the shape and body.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid sbyor //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i bdag nyid sbyor //
translated: The yoga of the nature of Vajrasattva

original: dbyibs dang sku ni ji ltar ldan pa ste //
analyzed: dbyibs dang sku ni ji ltar ldan pa ste //
translated: is endowed with the shape and body,

original: mi 'gyur mchog ni grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi 'gyur mchog ni grub par 'gyur //
translated: and the supreme unchanging is accomplished.

original: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be applied.

original: de gcig pu yin nam zhe na kun gyi bdag po ni ji lta bu bzhin du bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de gcig pu yin nam zhe na kun gyi bdag po ni ji lta bu bzhin du bshad pa ste /
translated: Is it only that? The lord of all is as explained.

original: de'i phyag rgya ni rang gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i lha rnams kyi phyag rgya rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya ni rang gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i lha rnams kyi phyag rgya rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: His seal is the four kinds of seals of the deities of the great mandala of his own lineage.

original: de dang lhan cig tu sbyor ba ni kun bdag phyag rgya'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu sbyor ba ni kun bdag phyag rgya'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The yoga with that is the yoga of the seal of the lord of all.

original: de nyid kyi bdag nyid ni rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni kun bdag phyag rgya'i sbyor ba'i bdag go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi bdag nyid ni rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni kun bdag phyag rgya'i sbyor ba'i bdag go //
translated: The nature of that is the nature of the yoga of the seal of the lord of all.

original: grub par gyur pa ni rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: grub par gyur pa ni rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Accomplishment is completion.

original: mi 'gyur mchog ni rtag pa ste thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur mchog ni rtag pa ste thog ma dang tha ma med pa'o //
translated: The unchanging supreme is the eternal, without beginning or end.

original: 'di ci zhes bya ba brjod pa yin zhe na //
analyzed: 'di ci zhes bya ba brjod pa yin zhe na //
translated: What is this?

original: 'di ni zhes bya bal sogs pa la thams cad rnal 'byor gyi bdag po zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya bal sogs pa la thams cad rnal 'byor gyi bdag po zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
translated: This is said by “this” and so on. All is connected with “the lord of yoga.”

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen po'i mtshan nyid @94a * //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen po'i mtshan nyid @94a * //
translated: This is the characteristic of the great yoga.

original: yin no // ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te gang gi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang gi bdag nyid dam tshig gsal ba ni rang gi rigs kyi ye shes sems dpa' rnams te de rnams kyi rjes su 'brang pas rang gi dam tshig gi rjes su 'gro
analyzed: yin no // ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te gang gi phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rang gi bdag nyid dam tshig gsal ba ni rang gi rigs kyi ye shes sems dpa' rnams te de rnams kyi rjes su 'brang pas rang gi dam tshig gi rjes su 'gro
translated: The word “ni” has the meaning of “because.” Because the clear commitment of the nature of all buddhas is the gnosis beings of one’s own family, they are followed by that, and one goes after one’s commitment.

original: ba ste / rang gi rigs kyi ye shes sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu gyur pas song ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba ste / rang gi rigs kyi ye shes sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu gyur pas song ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one goes together with the gnosis beings of one’s own family.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad kyi rnal 'byor rnams kyi bdag po ni gtso bo ste grub pa ni rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thams cad kyi rnal 'byor rnams kyi bdag po ni gtso bo ste grub pa ni rdzogs pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, the lord of all yogas is the chief, and the accomplishment is the perfection.

original: thams cad kyi rnal 'byor gyi bdag po ni rang bzhin gyis gsal ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rnal 'byor gyi bdag po ni rang bzhin gyis gsal ba'o //
translated: The lord of all yogas is the natural luminosity.

original: shin tu grub pa'i rnal 'byor gzhan las kyang mchog gi mchog yin pas na shin tu grub pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: shin tu grub pa'i rnal 'byor gzhan las kyang mchog gi mchog yin pas na shin tu grub pa'i mchog go //
translated: Since this is the supreme of all supreme accomplishments, it is the supreme of all supreme accomplishments.

original: rnal 'byor chen po 'di yang rdzogs pa'i cho ga sngar bshad pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po 'di yang rdzogs pa'i cho ga sngar bshad pa nyid de /
translated: This great yoga is also the complete rite that was previously explained;

original: slar yang bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: slar yang bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: it should not be explained again.
